excerpts: They have bowls, burritos, tacos etc... and you can make it fajita style (+$1.25) in which we did
burritos.author: Bethany M.
burritos.review:
If you like fresh, good Mexican food for a great price then you need to check this place out. We were walking back home after an afternoon stroll today and we came upon this place (found on yelp) and I'm so glad we did. 

We were craving Mexican earlier today & this spot definitely footed the bill. It's kind of like a better version of chipotle. They have bowls, burritos, tacos etc... and you can make it fajita style (+$1.25) in which we did and it was delicious. 

The chips salsa/guacamole was also really good as well. They have multiple salsas you can get, as well as other little toppings to add to your dish. Employees were friendly and service was fast!

excerpts: The burritos are reminiscent of authentic Mexico while at the same time giving you a modern fusion twist.
The ambiance is fun too!
Although small in square footage the line can snake around the corner during one of their famous taco Tuesday's.
Make sure to come by and have some amazing food with the best Mexican cuisine in the city.
burritos.author: Trip S.
burritos.review: TOMA! What an amazing array of items and each one better than the next. The burritos are reminiscent of authentic Mexico while at the same time giving you a modern fusion twist.  The ambiance is fun too! Although small in square footage the line can snake around the corner during one of their famous taco Tuesday's. Make sure to come by and have some amazing food with the best Mexican cuisine in the city.

excerpts: This place has the best burritos in the marina!
I love the breakfast burritos and usually add avocado-
they put a generous amount in the burrito and always use the freshest ingredients.
Their salsas are soooo delicious and they have several options.
It's a tiny order at the counter place but the food is excellent.
burritos.author: Lady N.
burritos.review: This place has the best burritos in the marina! I love the breakfast burritos and usually add avocado- they put a generous amount in the burrito and always use the freshest ingredients. Their salsas are soooo delicious and they have several options. It's a tiny order at the counter place but the food is excellent.

excerpts: There's a real lack of deliciousness that you normally find in burritos, maybe because it's filled primarily with very rice and beans (where's the meat in this
thing?)and the meat hasn't seen the love that most Mexican restaurants prioritize in giving?
Even if you pay for extras that should probably come standard (cream, guac), I'd set the bar pretty low for you walking out of there satisfied with your $13 burrito; it's just not working, IMO.
I can't tell if they're trying too hard or not enough with the ingredients.
Like, you know when you go to a restaurant that touts high quality ingredients
but then the food comes out
and it's just not that good?
It's kind of like that
but in burrito form which I have to imagine is just not that common.
Needless to say I'm surprised at the averageness of the burrito.
And don't get me wrong, the people working in there are friendly
it's just the burritos: they are very average.
Consider walking up to Tacko or Burrito Express On Divisadero.
burritos.author: Jason P.
burritos.review: Had tried this place a couple of years ago and thought it was average and after going back today that was confirmed: it's average...very average. There's a real lack of deliciousness that you normally find in burritos, maybe because it's filled primarily with very rice and beans (where's the meat in this thing?)and the meat hasn't seen the love that most Mexican restaurants prioritize in giving? Even if you pay for extras that should probably come standard (cream, guac), I'd set the bar pretty low for you walking out of there satisfied with your $13 burrito; it's just not working, IMO. I can't tell if they're trying too hard or not enough with the ingredients. Like, you know when you go to a restaurant that touts high quality ingredients but then the food comes out and it's just not that good? It's kind of like that but in burrito form which I have to imagine is just not that common. Needless to say I'm surprised at the averageness of the burrito. And don't get me wrong, the people working in there are friendly it's just the burritos: they are very average. Consider walking up to Tacko or Burrito Express On Divisadero.

excerpts: They have big (Delicious af) burritos, great guac, beer and good music.
This place is a hole in the wall
but it's so simple , no BS, just simple good Mexican food .
It's better than most sit down restaurants, definitely a great date spot .
Even better for if you are Intoxicated or under the influence of the good stuff.
Shout out to the girl at the counter
burritos.author: Dr T.
burritos.review: I was on chestnut street and I guess the premier Mexican food place is called "Tacolicious". The wait was an hour and a half and the food was over priced. Instead I found TOMA and lemme tell you...I'm glad I did . This place fills all the blanks  . They have big (Delicious af) burritos, great guac, beer and good music. This place is a hole in the wall but it's so simple , no BS, just simple good Mexican food . It's better than most sit down restaurants, definitely a great date spot . Even better for if you are Intoxicated or under the influence of the good stuff. Shout out to the girl at the counter

excerpts: They fry their burritos and add sweet peppers and onions by default so you might wanna tell them before hand.
burritos.author: Miguel E.
burritos.review:
Food is great here and reasonable price for being in the Marina. They fry their burritos and add sweet peppers and onions by default so you might wanna tell them before hand. Sour cream, gauc, cheese is all extra which I thought was crazy! But the servings are good and there's free salsa! 
PRO TIP: don't get any of the sides on "the side" they cost extra and if you check in at the place you get FREE CHIPS!

excerpts: The burritos here are great.
As good or better than the Mission with better ingredients.
Love the salsa bar too.
burritos.author: Ruth C.
burritos.review: The burritos here are great. As good or better than the Mission with better ingredients. Love the salsa bar too.

excerpts: Really good burritos and bowls.
burritos.author: Parthe P.
burritos.review: Affordable taqueria in the middle on a busy high end street. Really good burritos and bowls. Do try out the fish tacos

excerpts: Amazing burritos!
Favorite spot in the city and have recommended it to many others, their favorite too.
The Thursday chile verde burrito is my favorite, but any other day I have the chicken burrito.
Great for take out.
burritos.author: Rilee H.
burritos.review: Amazing burritos! Favorite spot in the city and have recommended it to many others, their favorite too. The Thursday chile verde burrito is my favorite, but any other day I have the chicken burrito. Great for take out.

excerpts: More than once I would pick up burritos
I ordered on the phone and when I got home
it wasn't prepared as I had asked.
Specifically: no pico de gallo.
The last time I went, it happen twice!
Once on the initial visit and then again when I returned to exchange for what were supposed tombs properly prepared burritos.
burritos.author: Cecil C.
burritos.review:
Disappointed with this place. Tried them a few times last year on Sundays because of their close proximity and they were open on the early side. Food was good enough for me to try them multiple times. 

More than once I would pick up burritos I ordered on the phone and when I got home it wasn't prepared as I had asked. Specifically: no pico de gallo. The last time I went, it happen twice! Once on the initial visit and then again when I returned to exchange for what were supposed tombs properly prepared burritos. 

I refuse to return.

excerpts: Delicious burritos and salsa in this no frills take out eatery on Steiner St.
The burritos were perfect, they made no mistakes.
We really enjoyed the flavor.
burritos.author: Tom T.
burritos.review: Delicious burritos and salsa in this no frills take out eatery on Steiner St.  The burritos were perfect, they made no mistakes. We really enjoyed the flavor.

excerpts: There's barely any meat in their burritos and everything is extra.
It's no Mission style burrito either.
So if you're looking for the authentic taste and value,go somewhere else.
burritos.author: Allison K.
burritos.review: The lady at the front has an attitude problem. She kept rolling her eyes and then continued talking to the people in the kitchen. There's barely any meat in their burritos and everything is extra. It's no Mission style burrito either. So if you're looking for the authentic taste and value,go somewhere else.

excerpts: I don't eat burritos too often
but I really like this place for those once a while cravings.
They use quality meat and ingredients.
Unlike most other tacquerias I've been to, the place doesn't smell like lard and neither does their food.
Giving them 4 stars only because I think The salsa bar is lacking and can use a bit of improvement and rice was a bit on the crunchy side.
Overall though, I love the place and will be back.
The vegetarian burritos are super tasty.
burritos.author: Miss M.
burritos.review: I don't eat burritos too often but I really like this place for those once a while cravings. They use quality meat and ingredients. Unlike most other tacquerias I've been to, the place doesn't smell like lard and neither does their food. Giving them 4 stars only because I think The salsa bar is lacking and can use a bit of improvement and rice was a bit on the crunchy side. Overall though, I love the place and will be back. The vegetarian burritos are super tasty. :)

excerpts: Their regular burritos and tacos are very average.
burritos.author: Nicholas H.
burritos.review:
Avoid this spot. I've tried their dinner food and their breakfast food now. Their regular burritos and tacos are very average. Definitely a three star at best meal. 

My friend described this place as a safe place to eat because it doesn't make him sick and he lives next door to it but it's nothing to write home about. 

The reason they've earned one star from me is because I tried their breakfast burrito this morning. It was mostly undercooked potatoes with maybe a single egg inside. It was horrible. Upon telling the staff that I was expecting some meat and egg they stared at me, said sorry and shrugged their shoulders. 

Their are too many better places in the area than to eat bad food with worse service. Eat here at your own risk.

excerpts: We all enjoyed our burritos and quesadillas - great flavor especially the carne asada.
The orders came out timely and the modifications we made to them were perfect.
We all felt great afterwards for having such big burritos!
The owner was there today and he was super friendly and attentive, there's definitely a pride in ownership here and we will all be returning!!!
burritos.author: Jasmine C.
burritos.review: My friends and I ate here today for lunch and it was great! We all enjoyed our burritos and quesadillas - great flavor especially the carne asada. The orders came out timely and the modifications we made to them were perfect. We all felt great afterwards for having such big burritos! The owner was there today and he was super friendly and attentive, there's definitely a pride in ownership here and we will all be returning!!!

excerpts: Burritos.
A staple particularly in This City of origin.
San Francisco is considered the historic center of the economical and handy meal.
I am not a huge fan of any other burrito in San Francisco: consider a venn diagram to consider all burritos in San Francisco - those you may walk or drive to in your local community.
That is one interesting fact about the distribution of burritos in the San Francisco: somehow, the Illuminati of Ethnic Foods make it impossible to have real choice.
Consider La Canasta, on Buchanan.
They have an attitude of convenience, a constant pulse of families, au pairs,
Burritos and pizza are in a neck and neck competition for the Lacrosse Moms and Dads as post- practice nutrition, reward and celebration substance.
burritos.author: Jim N.
burritos.review:
Burritos. A staple particularly in This City of origin. San Francisco is considered the historic center of the economical and handy meal. How do fringe purveyors compete, with, with the legacy and with the outliers?

TOMA is a huge addition to the Chestnut Street - Union Street communities of those who consider themselves connoisseurs and success stories in our Contemporary Era. When it was covered that, another, local vendor of Latino foods, had been frequented by one of our chosen, illustrious hurlers for a World Champion team of 'ballers, all was the rage, both for that singled-out provider of Fish Taco, but the lane, and its tangents, all providers of nutrition and flavor and texture, seemed to benefit: it is a challenge to arrive on time to one's Apple Store Genius Bar or Online Pickup appointment without having to step off of the curb and ride the bus stop to circumvent the words are wealthy eaters and shoppers at The Gap...

TOMA took over a small insert from a former 'dog vender, which, I could never understand, how they could have possibly made a dent in the food consciousness of those just down the street serving one of the best 'burger meals in town, at Barney's, or, the greenaholics' Vegan food and juicer, The Planet Cafe (don't get me started about the 10 other eateries across a spectrum one also has to consider as you approach this hole in the wall.)

The uniqueness of TOMA is in its entire presentation of an eatery. Yes, one can gather a traditional fare down and around the corner at Los Hermanos, But, there seems to be a Fish Taco price war heating up between LH and Tacolicious: on the way up, not down, a disservice to the consumer, despite many who have deep pockets.

What should one expect to pay for a burrito in San Francisco: any district to any degree of authenticity, substance, healthiness, cleanliness?

About $9.

Add shrimp? Another $2.

My only complaint with TOMA: the board featuring its daily special meat option is nowhere near the main menu above the register; I had no idea I had an option other than standard fare or their signature, pre-defined burrito.

Yet, the staff were kind enough to provide me with a taste sample of the daily special, which was absolutely amazing.

I had already committed to a pork protein which, grilled to order from a container where it had been marinating, was simply divine inside my burrito.

The size was not ginormous but it was substantial.

The beans were perfect: firm but giving to the teeth; fresh and flavorful; no extra liquid including the starchy substance one can encounter infusing a burrito.

The balance in texture, flavor, color, each ingredient layered, fresh: perfect.

I am not a huge fan of any other burrito in San Francisco: consider a venn diagram to consider all burritos in San Francisco - those you may walk or drive to in your local community.

That is one interesting fact about the distribution of burritos in the San Francisco: somehow, the Illuminati of Ethnic Foods make it impossible to have real choice. Consider La Canasta, on Buchanan. They have an attitude of convenience, a constant pulse of families, au pairs, nannies, 'sitters, double parked to pickup phone orders.

Burritos and pizza are in a neck and neck competition for the Lacrosse Moms and Dads as post- practice nutrition, reward and celebration substance.

TOMA is hungry for success. If you look at reviews on Yelp* over the past 7 months, notice how the criticism, possibly sound, has been matched by the staff in the food in front of you: it is improved at each step and turn.

Someone is reading these reviews and improving on a dime.

excerpts: Great burritos, good price!
About $8-$10 depending on extras, very filling and would come again.
burritos.author: Abigail H.
burritos.review: Great burritos, good price! About $8-$10 depending on extras, very filling and would come again.

excerpts: My hubby and I had burritos, his with chicken, mine with steak.
Both of us were commenting in how well seasoned the meat was to each other.
burritos.author: Britt P.
burritos.review:
My hubby and I had burritos, his with chicken, mine with steak. Both of us were commenting in how well seasoned the meat was to each other. We both enjoyed them immensely!

Note: The place is tiny. There are about 6 or 7 chairs to sit on at a bar style table, and 2 tables outside. Delicious food, though! Definitely recommend!

excerpts: Burrito was excellent, loved the steak and fajitas, only reason it didn't get 5 stars was it was smaller than most burritos I get from taquerias
burritos.author: Matt W.
burritos.review: Burrito was excellent, loved the steak and fajitas, only reason it didn't get 5 stars was it was smaller than most burritos I get from taquerias

excerpts: I've been pretty underwhelmed with the "top burritos" in San Francisco, finding them to be unbearably bland, or made with poor quality ingredients, so
I was pleasantly surprised to find something tasty in my neighborhood.
I'll definitely be back to try the nachos, and get more burritos!
burritos.author: Gieselle A.
burritos.review: I was pleasantly surprised by Toma. Got their regular burrito with carne asada. It was very flavorful and the ingredients tasted fresh. I've been pretty underwhelmed with the "top burritos" in San Francisco, finding them to be unbearably bland, or made with poor quality ingredients, so I was pleasantly surprised to find something tasty in my neighborhood.  I'll definitely be back to try the nachos, and get more burritos!

excerpts: Huge breakfast burritos that will leave you full until dinner time.
You can substitute potatoes for rice in the breakfast burrito.
burritos.author: Michelle W.
burritos.review:
If you want a damn good breakfast burrito, you will find it at this place. 

Huge breakfast burritos that will leave you full until dinner time. You can substitute potatoes for rice in the breakfast burrito. I had the vegetarian burrito but the veggies were well-seasoned and was no where near bland, which can sometimes be the case with vegetarian dishes. Make sure to grab the sauces to layer on with each bite, they add a nice flavor kick to each bite. The guacamole is absolutely delicious here. There isn't much seating so it's best to order takeout and take your meal to the Marina Green or back home. 

Also, ToMa is an inexpensive breakfast option for the city!

excerpts: Their tortas are good and burritos are decent.
Their salsa bar is a fun perk as I love to drench my food in salsas caseras.
The service is always great with their friendly cashiers.
My husband likes their beer options and enjoys the small corner taqueria style of the restaurant.
burritos.author: Cindy G.
burritos.review: If you are in the neighborhood on a Monday you definitely should try their chile colorado special in a bowl, very tasty! Their tortas are good and burritos are decent. Their salsa bar is a fun perk as I love to drench my food in salsas caseras. The service is always great with their friendly cashiers. My husband likes their beer options and enjoys the small corner taqueria style of the restaurant.

excerpts: Fast, friendly service and the burritos were inexpensive and very filling.
burritos.author: Rickie J.
burritos.review:
A great new biz around the corner from the San Fran hotel we were staying at. Fast, friendly service and the burritos were inexpensive and very filling.

There are literally a handful of chairs inside  and couple of tables outside so it sure is 'fast food' where they are expecting much more of the take-out crowd rather than sit in but it seems to be working so far.

excerpts: I needed a bunch of breakfast burritos for a kids birthday party.
Ysidro, the owner, was great to work with.
The modified the ingredients a little so that they were just perfect for kids.
He also met me at the store several hours before they opened so that I could get the burritos in time.
It worked out great.
burritos.author: Michelle D.
burritos.review:
Love this place!  Food is fantastic (and authentic).  Prices are very reasonable.  I always add a few dollars to my bill with a Horchada, but it is always worth it.  Best Horchadas ever!!!

Usually, I just stop in for lunch or grab dinner to go.  I have also used their catering.  I needed a bunch of breakfast burritos for a kids birthday party.  Ysidro, the owner, was great to work with. The modified the ingredients a little so that they were just perfect for kids.  He also met me at the store several hours before they opened so that I could get the burritos in time.  It worked out great.  I was initially going to order from a breakfast spot in the 'hood, but they wouldn't accommodate any of my requests and were going to charge me twice as much,

I always feel good about buying from TOMA.  The entire staff is great and the food is always good.

excerpts: Awesome burritos.
Their specials are amazing, especially the barbacoa and carnitas.
Breakfast burritos are good as well.
I wish their guacamole was a bit creamier/thicker, but it's still good.
The staff is also very friendly.
burritos.author: Maxwell B.
burritos.review: Awesome burritos. Their specials are amazing, especially the barbacoa and carnitas. Breakfast burritos are good as well. I wish their guacamole was a bit creamier/thicker, but it's still good. The staff is also very friendly.

excerpts: Be sure you order it how you like it: there are lots of hidden menu options: best burritos & Mexican food in Marina/Cow Hollow!!
burritos.author: Jason E.
burritos.review:
All natural ingredients; made to order.  Be sure you order it how you like it: there are lots of hidden menu options: best burritos & Mexican food in Marina/Cow Hollow!!

My favorite is the Chili Verde on Thursdays or the Chicken Burrito: 1/2 the beans/rice + the spicy pico salsa + the salsa verde + onions/cilantro + Avocado (instead of Guac) and no cheese.

And the breakfast burrito always hits the spot when I get there earlier in the day.

The on-line ordering is an easy way to get my custom order just right!

And the tamales on the weekend taste just like the home made ones my family makes!

Once you figure out your favorite salsa and spiciness you'll be coming back all the time!

excerpts: For the food, I would recommend the chicken burritos or tacos.
Those are my constant go-tos.
Squeeze some lime and put the mild red sauce on it
and it just tastes delicious.
Also, if you like mushrooms or squash, both choices are excellent and very flavorful.
I love mushrooms so sometimes I just get a mushroom burrito and some cantaloupe agua fresca and call it a day.
Speaking of their agua frescas, all the flavors I've ever tried are
so so soo good.
Cantaloupe, watermelon, pineapple and the horchata are all amazing and pair perfectly with the food.
burritos.author: Jessica L.
burritos.review:
TOMA is my favorite place to get my Mexican food fix.  I usually go at least once a week if not twice.  Their food is very fresh and clean which I like in Mexican food.  I'm not a fan of super greasy Mexican food that's dripping with oil.  The customer service is excellent too.  Everyone is extremely friendly and attentive.  

For the food, I would recommend the chicken burritos or tacos.  Those are my constant go-tos.  Squeeze some lime and put the mild red sauce on it and it just tastes delicious.  Also, if you like mushrooms or squash, both choices are excellent and very flavorful. I love mushrooms so sometimes I just get a mushroom burrito and some cantaloupe agua fresca and call it a day.  Speaking of their agua frescas, all the flavors I've ever tried are so so soo good.  Cantaloupe, watermelon, pineapple and the horchata are all amazing and pair perfectly with the food.  I definitely find myself craving the juices on those rare warm days in SF.

The other day I decided to try a chicken quesadilla with guacamole and sour cream and it was the best decision I made that week!  I love quesadillas with just cheese and chicken, but with the extras it was just unbelievably yummy.  Their quesadillas are huge too and I ate the whole thing in one sitting because it was that good.  I was very proud of myself that day.  

If you're ever in the Marina and craving Mexican food, definitely give this spot a try.  You won't be disappointed and I think you'll even walk away impressed by everything TOMA has to offer.  I know I am!

excerpts: When people think Mexican food, I feel the first thing they think of is burritos.
Word of advice: DON'T GET THE BURRITOS.
They will NOT satisfy you.
The burritos are dry and if you get carne asada it will be dry and tough and cut far too big.
The chicken burritos weren't any better.
Chicken was good but the rest was dry.
In conclusion, get the chicken torta.
burritos.author: Tania C.
burritos.review:
Okay so this place is hit or miss. I work nearby so I had the chance to come here 3 days in a row basically (because of a paypal coupon).
When people think Mexican food, I feel the first thing they think of is burritos. Word of advice: DON'T GET THE BURRITOS. They will NOT satisfy you. However, DO GET THE TORTAS. 
My fav is the chicken torta. It is amazing and warm and toasty and savory and sure to make you happy.
The burritos are dry and if you get carne asada it will be dry and tough and cut far too big. The chicken burritos weren't any better. Chicken was good but the rest was dry. 
In conclusion, get the chicken torta. You will not regret it. 


UPDATE: MY TORTA BREAD WAS MOLDY. SO DISAPPOINTED

excerpts: Simply amazing burritos made however you like.
Fajita style, chile verde, you name it.
But it will fill you for the entire day, and will be one of the best burritos you've ever had in your life.
burritos.author: Brian C.
burritos.review:
TOMA is really just a taco/burrito takeout joint, but boy what a joint it is. Simply amazing burritos made however you like. Fajita style, chile verde, you name it. I had the pork chile verde with fajita veggies. The nice gentleman behind the counter gave me a sample and I was hooked. Said it was slow cooked for many hours. 

Indeed, it was mouth watering. We then chatted for a while. I asked him about the salsas. He pointed to one in the back and said it was his favorite because it was his grandmother's recipe and he grew up with it. Gotta appreciate that. Be warned, the burrito will cost you $10. But it will fill you for the entire day, and will be one of the best burritos you've ever had in your life.

excerpts: Not a huge menu, but after tacos, burritos, and tortas
I'm not sure what else you need.
I wish they opened earlier for breakfast burritos on the weekend.
burritos.author: Nathan W.
burritos.review:
Solid and dependable option in the Marina. Not a huge menu, but after tacos, burritos, and tortas I'm not sure what else you need. I wish they opened earlier for breakfast burritos on the weekend.

Great salsa. Go for habanero. Just the right amount of kick. Glad they opened up.

excerpts: Definitely one of the best burritos I've had in the Marina area.
and although I was full, I didn't feel sluggish, which is usually my problem with burritos.
burritos.author: Hana K.
burritos.review: Definitely one of the best burritos I've had in the Marina area. I ordered a chicken burrito and chips and guacamole for delivery. The burrito's here are standard. It includes a flour tortilla, your choice of meat/vegetables, your choice of refried or black beans, cheese, and pico de gallo. I added guacamole to my chicken burrito for a $1 so it ended up being $8.25. The burrito was delicious and it was decently sized. It took me two sittings to eat it and although I was full, I didn't feel sluggish, which is usually my problem with burritos. The chips and guacamole were a great deal for $4. It came with a lot of guacamole and although the chips were a little salty, it was still good. The delivery was around 45 minutes but our food came fresh and warm. Will definitely order from here again!

excerpts: They have a small but complete menu with burritos, tacos and quesadillas.
They serve the meat eaters and veggie crowds as well, which is important to my husband who is a vegetarian.
He had their mushroom burrito and said it hit the spot.
I had the beef and chicken tacos, which were flavorful.
burritos.author: Natalie S.
burritos.review:
So glad Toma is here! My husband and I were so sad when Chilayo closed.  It was our go to Mexican place in our neighborhood.  Yes, there are a lot of other Mexican restaurants in the area, but all are a "scene". And sometimes you just want good, simple food.  Toma is it! They have a small but complete menu with burritos, tacos and quesadillas. They serve the meat eaters and veggie crowds as well, which is important to my husband who is a vegetarian.  He had their mushroom burrito and said it hit the spot.  I had the beef and chicken tacos, which were flavorful.  We also had a side of guacamole which tasted so fresh.  

Anyway, I'm glad they are nearby and can't wait to get my fix again soon!

excerpts: The burritos are huge, tasty and keep you full for hours.
Cute little place, ok service.
burritos.author: Nina G.
burritos.review: The burritos are huge, tasty and keep you full for hours. Cute little place, ok service.

excerpts: The breakfast burritos are excellent as well.
I get the ham and egg breakfast burrito with potatoes, add avocado and drench with the red mild sauce.
Mmmmmm
burritos.author: Matt N.
burritos.review: I work around the corner and have tried all the Mexican places in the area--by far Toma is always the best. I grew up in so-cal so I'm pretty spoiled with unbeatable mom and pop taquerias at every corner. Toma always has super fresh ingredients, delicious salsa options (love the mild red, would buy by the gallon if possible), and ridiculously tasty marinated and freshly grilled meat! I usually get adobado, but every other meat I've tried is great too. The breakfast burritos are excellent as well. I get the ham and egg breakfast burrito with potatoes, add avocado and drench with the red mild sauce. Mmmmmm

excerpts: I usually order burritos, so perhaps the other items are better.
burritos.author: S T.
burritos.review:
Sometimes the food is very good. A lot of times however it's way over salted and barely edible, as in tonight.  I usually order burritos, so perhaps the other items are better.

Also, what's the aversion to including salsa in delivery options? When you get Mexican food a reasonable assumption is that you'll receive salsa (not a side of pico de gallo they expect you to pay extra for). I have made specific requests for them to add this and flat out been told it's not possible by the gal on the phone.

Customer service is lacking. 

Advice: reduce the salt, throw in a couple to go salsas, and improve the overall customer service.

excerpts: Burritos are gigantic and the basic meats are good (I've tried chicken and pork).
But if you're in pac heights/the marina, you're not gonna find much cheaper or a better price-to-food ratio (again, burritos are huge).
burritos.author: Tiffany Y.
burritos.review:
Burritos are gigantic and the basic meats are good (I've tried chicken and pork). Wasn't a huge fan of their barbacoa, which is one of their specials, but their chicken mole (tues special) is to die for. 

Pretty expensive for a burrito with ordinary offerings of rice, beans, meat, and pico. Plus it costs extra to add sour cream and guacamole. But if you're in pac heights/the marina, you're not gonna find much cheaper or a better price-to-food ratio (again, burritos are huge). 

No more than 4 seats indoors and a couple of seats outside. The guy behind the counter who does the lunch shift is really helpful (will offer you samples) and friendly.

excerpts: Nachos, tacos and burritos....
This place absolutely knocks the basics out of the park.
burritos.author: Adam H.
burritos.review:
Nachos, tacos and burritos.... This place absolutely knocks the basics out of the park. Their tortillas are the freshest which makes all the difference in taste/texture.

Absolutely would recommend this to anyone.

excerpts: This used to be my go-to spot for burritos in the Marina.
The prices are good, they are usually pretty quick, and the food is great for the price.
That being said, NEVER use their online APP.
I recently placed an order on their app and it never confirmed that the order went through.

As a result I re-ordered on the APP and 30 minutes later a double order arrived at my house at which point I have been charged double tip, double delivery fees, and now have double the food (which I do not want).

Despite speaking with 4 different employees about the issue (over the course of 2 weeks) and them all promising me that the manager will call me back (he never called), they have since blamed me for the glitch in their app and refuse to refund the additional $42 worth of charges.
I used to be a loyal customer, but after their dismissive and rude responses and refusal to correct the mistake caused by their own app I will not be going back.
Luckily there are plenty of alternatives in the neighborhood.
burritos.author: Tori P.
burritos.review: This used to be my go-to spot for burritos in the Marina. The prices are good, they are usually pretty quick, and the food is great for the price. That being said, NEVER use their online APP. I recently placed an order on their app and it never confirmed that the order went through. As a result I re-ordered on the APP and 30 minutes later a double order arrived at my house at which point I have been charged double tip, double delivery fees, and now have double the food (which I do not want). Despite speaking with 4 different employees about the issue (over the course of 2 weeks) and them all promising me that the manager will call me back (he never called), they have since blamed me for the glitch in their app and refuse to refund the additional $42 worth of charges. I used to be a loyal customer, but after their dismissive and rude responses and refusal to correct the mistake caused by their own app I will not be going back. Luckily there are plenty of alternatives in the neighborhood.

excerpts: Perfect for burritos on the go, especially if you appreciate a home made tortilla.
We will probably come back for burritos :)
burritos.author: Meredith M.
burritos.review:
Always great to have a new burrito spot in the neighborhood, and that's exactly what toma is. Perfect for burritos on the go, especially if you appreciate a home made tortilla. 

The staff is very friendly and welcoming, but thay didn't really compensate for the boring tacos. I had the mushroom and pork tacos, and they were just ok...a little bland. 

My boyfriend had tue carne asada burrito and it was very good!  We will probably come back for burritos :)

excerpts: Love the tortas, the burritos, and the fresh tortilla made a tacos.
burritos.author: David R.
burritos.review:
Absolutely. Love. This. Place.

Fresh, tasty and satisfying on every level. While mex has always been a challenge in the marina, this place brings some credibility to the area. And they deliver. Love the tortas, the burritos, and the fresh tortilla made a tacos. Everything is freshly cooked made-to-order and you can tell.

Definitely one of my favorites in the area and worth a stop for at least a taco/small bite, if not dinner.

excerpts: I should know by now that if I'm paying $30 for two burritos and two beers, I'm in the wrong place.
Actually, one of the burritos was just rice and beans, and the "beer" was an agua fresca which makes paying that much infuriating.
Overall it was ok
but we'll be going to Los Hermanos next time
we get burrito cravings.
burritos.author: Daffodil K.
burritos.review:
Overpriced and nothing special.  I should know by now that if I'm paying $30 for two burritos and two beers, I'm in the wrong place. 

Actually, one of the burritos was just rice and beans, and the "beer" was an agua fresca which makes paying that much infuriating. Overall it was ok but we'll be going to Los Hermanos next time we get burrito cravings.

excerpts: Disgusting, boring, overpriced burritos now.
Over the years a gradual, decline, to blah.
burritos.author: Anon A.
burritos.review: Disgusting, boring, overpriced burritos now.  Over the years a gradual, decline, to blah.

excerpts: I have had burritos and chips and guacamole on my lunch breaks but my newest favorite is the bowl featured below with black beans, Guac, and the calabacitas veggie option (both are great by the way), and topped with fresh limes and hot sauce complimentary for customers to grab.
If you feel like a big spender, try the Horchata, it's the perfect amount of sweet.
burritos.author: Jasmine W.
burritos.review: Always a good meal here, and love sitting and talking to whoever is working the register and cooking my food! I'm a vegetarian and I switch it up and my boyfriend swears my there carne asada! It is a small place so very easy to miss off of Steiner, in between a parking garage and Barney's, but trust you do not want to miss it. I have had burritos and chips and guacamole on my lunch breaks but my newest favorite is the bowl featured below with black beans, Guac, and the calabacitas veggie option (both are great by the way), and topped with fresh limes and hot sauce complimentary for customers to grab. If you feel like a big spender, try the Horchata, it's the perfect amount of sweet.

excerpts: This is our fave spot in the Marina/Cow Hollow for burritos.
Not only is the meat freshly cooked for each order that helps kick up the flavor another notch, but the ingredients are piled high making the burrito size mucho grande.
I'm often shocked how expensive these Mexican places in the neighborhood can be (Tacko, Tacolicious, Mamacita, Sabrosa, etc.) but TOMA is the exception.
We're also pleased that every person we've met working the register has always been friendly and courteous.
The free salsas are also a nice touch.
Don't miss out on their breakfast burritos!
burritos.author: Ryan E.
burritos.review: This is our fave spot in the Marina/Cow Hollow for burritos. Not only is the meat freshly cooked for each order that helps kick up the flavor another notch, but the ingredients are piled high making the burrito size mucho grande. I'm often shocked how expensive these Mexican places in the neighborhood can be (Tacko, Tacolicious, Mamacita, Sabrosa, etc.) but TOMA is the exception. We're also pleased that every person we've met working the register has always been friendly and courteous. The free salsas are also a nice touch. Don't miss out on their breakfast burritos!

excerpts: Super good burritos.
And I LOVE burritos.
The salsa bar is great.
I got the carne asana.
Great tender meat.
There were a few " gritty, fatty" pieces which is not my favorite.
Overall a great place
and I have a feeling I'll be having a hankering for them again.
burritos.author: Lindsay J.
burritos.review: Super good burritos. And I LOVE burritos. The salsa bar is great. I got the carne asana. Great tender meat. There were a few " gritty, fatty" pieces which is not my favorite. Overall a great place and I have a feeling I'll be having a hankering for them again.

excerpts: The Fajita burritos are scrumptious.
Don't look any further.
Try it out.
I usually stock on a few burritos and conquer them over the next couple of days.
Nice people, too.
burritos.author: Tom D.
burritos.review: This is the best Mexican food I've found in the Cow Hollow/Marina area. Absolutely amazing. It's not just the tacos. The Fajita burritos are scrumptious. Don't look any further. Try it out. I usually stock on a few burritos and conquer them over the next couple of days. Nice people, too.

excerpts: Usually I like my burritos with no meat (although I am not a vegetarian), and don't usually choose the veggie option either.
This time I decided to go with the yellow squash/zucchini/tomato option.
It was good, but kind of overpowered the other flavors.
burritos.author: Alexandra W.
burritos.review: Got a burrito this time. Usually I like my burritos with no meat (although I am not a vegetarian), and don't usually choose the veggie option either. This time I decided to go with the yellow squash/zucchini/tomato option. It was good, but kind of overpowered the other flavors.

excerpts: 30$ for 2 burritos and 2 drinks.
Would come back, just need to read the menu a little clearer.
burritos.author: Melissa M.
burritos.review: First of all, I didn't know you had to ask for sour cream and guac separately and pay extra. Most taquerias just automatically put all that stuff in there. Other than that the food was pretty good. 30$ for 2 burritos and 2 drinks. Would come back, just need to read the menu a little clearer.

excerpts: Their burritos are alright but their tacos are good.
They're a bit pricey but its bearable.
burritos.author: Tina F.
burritos.review: Their burritos are alright but their tacos are good. They're a bit pricey but its bearable.

excerpts: They also serve three different breakfast burritos, which I frequently crave.
This place puts to shame many of the infamous Mission District taquerias.
Do yourself a favor- stop reading and get over there.
burritos.author: Martha D.
burritos.review: Simply amazing Mexican food. I have frequented TOMA since they moved into the Marina, and have NEVER been let down. Their champinones burrito (mushroom and poblano pepper) is a refreshingly different version of the vegetarian burrito, and is delicious. Their meat selections are always very tender, fresh, and traditionally prepared. Carne asada and chicken mole are two of my favorites. They also serve three different breakfast burritos, which I frequently crave. This place puts to shame many of the infamous Mission District taquerias. Do yourself a favor- stop reading and get over there.

excerpts: I've only ever had the sopes, tacos, and burritos, but they always do an excellent job.
The service does take a little longer, but they really do just put that much more effort into the food.
The girl working at the counter was such a doll-she greeted every customer that came in with a smile and was also extremely helpful.
My first time there, I wasn't sure what to get.
burritos.author: Kristen M.
burritos.review:
I am a huge Mexican food fan and Toma is my favorite spot in the city.
I've only ever had the sopes, tacos, and burritos, but they always do an excellent job.
The service does take a little longer, but they really do just put that much more effort into the food.
The girl working at the counter was such a doll-she greeted every customer that came in with a smile and was also extremely helpful. My first time there, I wasn't sure what to get.  She recommended the champinones (mushroom) and asada burrito and it was delicious!  
Definitely eat here!

excerpts: Toma puts a good amount of meat in their burritos too!!!
Will be back!
burritos.author: Lauren W.
burritos.review: Great place for a quick burrito and also if traveling to Papalote is too far on a Sunday night. Toma puts a good amount of meat in their burritos too!!! Will be back!

excerpts: One of the worst, flavorless burritos I have had in recent memory.
This place won't be open long if they keep producing a burrito of this caliber.
They make Los Hermanos look like French Laundry.
burritos.author: Jason R.
burritos.review: I have no idea how this place has gotten these reviews. One of the worst, flavorless burritos I have had in recent memory. This place won't be open long if they keep producing a burrito of this caliber. They make Los Hermanos look like French Laundry.

excerpts: My husband is addicted to burritos and gets them wherever we go.
My husband is addicted to burritos and gets them wherever we go.
He said that Toma has the best ones he has ever had.
burritos.author: Violet F.
burritos.review:
We were visiting SF and came across this place via Yelp reviews. It was so great (cheap fresh delicious homemade type food) that we went totally out of our way the next day just to go back there again! My husband is addicted to burritos and gets them wherever we go. He said that Toma has the best ones he has ever had.

We were visiting SF and came across this place via Yelp reviews. It was so great (cheap fresh delicious homemade type food) that we went totally out of our way the next day just to go back there again! My husband is addicted to burritos and gets them wherever we go. He said that Toma has the best ones he has ever had.

excerpts: Burritos were wrapped well.
Id pass on making the burrito wet
but that's because I'm not the biggest mole sauce fan.
Will definitely go back.
burritos.author: KK R.
burritos.review: Delicious Mexican!  Would highly recommend this place - quality ingredients and authentic Mexican food.  The grilled chicken is amazing - great seasoning and nicely grilled.  The barbacoa was amazing!  So juicy but not greasy.  Burritos were wrapped well.  Id pass on making the burrito wet but that's because I'm not the biggest mole sauce fan.  Will definitely go back.

excerpts: Nice little place for late night tacos, burritos, and other goodies.
High End ingredients and really cheap prices are easy on the taste buds and wallet.
burritos.author: Michael L.
burritos.review: Nice little place for late night tacos, burritos, and other goodies. High End ingredients and really cheap prices are easy on the taste buds and wallet.

excerpts: Delicious chicken burritos with some unusual flavors (mushrooms!)
and a modern restaurant design make this a great place to seek out -- Highly recommended!
burritos.author: Eric M.
burritos.review: Just moved to SF and discovered this great gem on its opening day while looking for food in the Marina District. Delicious chicken burritos with some unusual flavors (mushrooms!) and a modern restaurant design make this a great place to seek out -- Highly recommended!

excerpts: Tacos were excellent and the service was super friendly!
Also had the horchata and it was delish.
tacos.author: Kevin H.
tacos.review: Tacos were excellent and the service was super friendly! Also had the horchata and it was delish.

excerpts: They have bowls, burritos, tacos etc... and you can make it fajita style (+$1.25) in which we did
tacos.author: Bethany M.
tacos.review:
If you like fresh, good Mexican food for a great price then you need to check this place out. We were walking back home after an afternoon stroll today and we came upon this place (found on yelp) and I'm so glad we did. 

We were craving Mexican earlier today & this spot definitely footed the bill. It's kind of like a better version of chipotle. They have bowls, burritos, tacos etc... and you can make it fajita style (+$1.25) in which we did and it was delicious. 

The chips salsa/guacamole was also really good as well. They have multiple salsas you can get, as well as other little toppings to add to your dish. Employees were friendly and service was fast!

excerpts: But after I got my tacos I realized there is a difference between a freshly made corn tortilla and a HAND-made tortilla.
Anyhow, the tortilla itself was thick and too soft - to the point where I could not taste it
and it kind of dissolved a bit from the liquid coming from the meat.
They have special meats of the day and on Wednesdays it's carnitas.
I also got a carne asada and camarones (shrimp) taco.
The meat quality was great, the carne asada had large chunks of steak that was still a little rare, which I liked a lot.
tacos.author: Cecille W.
tacos.review:
As always, I was lured in by the promise of a freshly-made corn tortilla. But after I got my tacos I realized there is a difference between a freshly made corn tortilla and a HAND-made tortilla. Anyhow, the tortilla itself was thick and too soft - to the point where I could not taste it and it kind of dissolved a bit from the liquid coming from the meat. They have special meats of the day and on Wednesdays it's carnitas. I also got a carne asada and camarones (shrimp) taco. ($3.25 each) The meat quality was great, the carne asada had large chunks of steak that was still a little rare, which I liked a lot. Shrimp and carnitas were made perfectly and well seasoned. 

My boyfriend ordered a carne asada quesadilla, a horchata, and a side of guacamole. He too, said the carne asada was really good. The salsa bar is limited and none of the salsas really stood out to me, they were pretty bland. The guac costs an extra dollar-something and they give it to you in a small container the same size as you would get from the salsa bar. I was disappointed to find that the guacamole was even more bland and very lacking in seasoning compared to other Mexican places I've been to. If you check in on Yelp, you get a free bag of chips but you can tell that the chips are not made in store and probably from a bag. *sigh* 

There is a sign that says there is a secret menu if you go on their website, but we went on the website only to find that neither the items on the menu nor the prices match up (it's now more expensive). I think Toma is an okay place to get Mexican food but like another Yelper said, it's not mind-blowing. It's also very small inside with only one table and a few bar style seats against the wall.

excerpts: While waiting for a dinner reservation I stopped by Toma to try some tacos, because why not?!
It smelled
so delicious outside
I had to go in
, we ordered 3 tacos - carne asada, adobado, and mahi mahi.
Man these were so good!!!
My favorite was definitely the mahi mahi!
At almost $4 a taco, it's not the cheapest option in the city, but I got delicious tacos and great service in a nice part of town
so I'm not complaining.
tacos.author: Jenny E.
tacos.review: While waiting for a dinner reservation I stopped by Toma to try some tacos, because why not?! It smelled so delicious outside I had to go in, we ordered 3 tacos - carne asada, adobado, and mahi mahi. Man these were so good!!! My favorite was definitely the mahi mahi! At almost $4 a taco, it's not the cheapest option in the city, but I got delicious tacos and great service in a nice part of town so I'm not complaining.

excerpts: "" I will return & try burrito or some tacos
tacos.author: Sean K.
tacos.review: Ok " I'm mean let's be real is the Marina known for Mexican food " 3s hermanos is legit " but these guys are convenient, professional, good salsas " but my torta was lack luster "" I will return & try burrito or some tacos

excerpts: I sampled some of their tacos today and
tacos.author: Jessica T.
tacos.review:
I love Mexican spots that offer up organic meat. Toma sources their meats from Golden Gate Company and you can taste the freshness in each bite.

I sampled some of their tacos today and while I enjoyed the thick corn tortilla and the well seasoned Adobado - I don't think I will go out my way to order delivery from them again. 

Their guacamole was fairly tasteless and outside of the delightful tortilla shell - I was not overly impressed with my meal.

If you're looking for fresh organic Mexican food - I recommend sticking to Don Pistos or Nopalito.

Trust.

excerpts: It's definitely on my radar and my next stop if I'm craving tacos around the Marina.
tacos.author: Joshua F.
tacos.review:
A tad pricey but definitely good eating.

Got asada, adobado (pork) and mahi mahi. All three meats were really good. The tortilla was one of the best (non-traditional semi-thick and floury) I've had.

The tortilla is probably why those who order through a delivery service do not like their meal. I can totally see the tortilla going bad if it's not eaten within 5 minutes of being made.

Not "authentic" but better than most. It fits perfectly right into the Marina District's vibe. It's definitely on my radar and my next stop if I'm craving tacos around the Marina.

excerpts: Excellent fish tacos, fresh and grilled to perfection.
Quick and simple dinner out on a Saturday just what we wanted before heading home to the burbs.
Limited sit down dining in tiny space but eating early at 5:30p
it wasn't a problem.
Nothing fancy but satisfying.
tacos.author: Gordon H.
tacos.review: Excellent fish tacos, fresh and grilled to perfection.  Quick and simple dinner out on a Saturday just what we wanted before heading home to the burbs.  Limited sit down dining in tiny space but eating early at 5:30p it wasn't a problem.  Nothing fancy but satisfying.

excerpts: Salsa is super fresh  and the tacos are awesome really flavorful.
If u like tacos and are in the area you should stop at Toma!
tacos.author: Rich A.
tacos.review: Wow, really great little taco stand.  Salsa is super fresh  and the tacos are awesome really flavorful.  If u like tacos and are in the area you should stop at Toma!

excerpts: Do try out the fish tacos
tacos.author: Parthe P.
tacos.review: Affordable taqueria in the middle on a busy high end street. Really good burritos and bowls. Do try out the fish tacos

excerpts: Tacos are amazing and it doesn't cost me half of my rent.
They have a nice outdoor area to eat at
but it's not a lot of seating
so for sure take it to go.
You can online order and pick it up super quickly.
When you order guac it's a ton and its so fresh and tastes amazing!
I will always keep going back to this place, you guys keep showing Tacko what's up with their weird ass not mexican themed mexican place.
Love you Toma!
tacos.author: Shawna M.
tacos.review: Y'all this place is great. If you're in the marina and need want fresh mexican food with everything made in house, this is it. Tacos are amazing and it doesn't cost me half of my rent. They have a nice outdoor area to eat at but it's not a lot of seating so for sure take it to go. You can online order and pick it up super quickly. When you order guac it's a ton and its so fresh and tastes amazing! I will always keep going back to this place, you guys keep showing Tacko what's up with their weird ass not mexican themed mexican place. Love you Toma!

excerpts: I think I just about fell in love with their shrimp tacos and their carne asada rojas burrito...
Shrimp tacos were just about perrrfect.
Shrimp was super moist and cooked just right.
Everything about this taco was juicy AF.
Tortilla was freshly made!
Go for the shrimp tacos if anything!!!
Burrito to follow.
Skip out on the sopas.
tacos.author: Carena N.
tacos.review:
I think I just about fell in love with their shrimp tacos and their carne asada rojas burrito...

Shrimp tacos were just about perrrfect.  Shrimp was super moist and cooked just right.  Everything about this taco was juicy AF.  Tortilla was freshly made!  It was thicker than what I'm usually used to, but still very good!

Carne asada roja burrito was mouth-watering.  So much juicy meat and the extra peppers were delicious.  Not spicy at all, but that can be fixed with some Tapatio or spicy salsa.

Only thing that I didn't like so much was the Pork Sopas.  Meat was a bit dry, and too much sopa.  Too much, too thick.  @_@ Two sopas in each order was already way too much for one sitting.  Also, too much beans which really overpowered the entire thing.  The beef sauce that came with this was delicious though!

Go for the shrimp tacos if anything!!! Burrito to follow.  Skip out on the sopas.  Check in for free chips! Go! *___*

excerpts: Perfect fish tacos!
Great location!
A fun lunch place for sure!
Loved it xo
tacos.author: Megan B.
tacos.review: Delicious! Perfect fish tacos! Great location! A fun lunch place for sure! Loved it xo

excerpts: Pretty tasty little taco place, with delicious fish tacos.
A little salty (but I love salt, so nbd for me), but the flavors were great.
tacos.author: Amber H.
tacos.review: Pretty tasty little taco place, with delicious fish tacos. A little salty (but I love salt, so nbd for me), but the flavors were great. Also had the corn quesadillas with mushrooms, which were pretty tasty--the fish is definitely the star of the show. Great salsas and nice enough seating if it's not too busy. Would come back if I were in the area.

excerpts: Born and raised in SF...by far the best tacos EVER!
Homemade corn tortillas...makes you wanna slap the cook or cashier after the first bite!!!
tacos.author: Karen C.
tacos.review: Born and raised in SF...by far the best tacos EVER! Homemade corn tortillas...makes you wanna slap the cook or cashier after the first bite!!!

excerpts: Their regular burritos and tacos are very average.
tacos.author: Nicholas H.
tacos.review:
Avoid this spot. I've tried their dinner food and their breakfast food now. Their regular burritos and tacos are very average. Definitely a three star at best meal. 

My friend described this place as a safe place to eat because it doesn't make him sick and he lives next door to it but it's nothing to write home about. 

The reason they've earned one star from me is because I tried their breakfast burrito this morning. It was mostly undercooked potatoes with maybe a single egg inside. It was horrible. Upon telling the staff that I was expecting some meat and egg they stared at me, said sorry and shrugged their shoulders. 

Their are too many better places in the area than to eat bad food with worse service. Eat here at your own risk.

excerpts: Items I've tried, whether the sopas or some tacos, have come out dripping wet and drowning in sauce, and their taste just wasn't all that memorable.

While I get that this might be a neighborhood favorite because it feels like a clean and "safe" space for gringos, there are so many more authentic and worthwhile experiences elsewhere in the city if you're craving some true Mexican food.
tacos.author: Vincent L.
tacos.review: Not as impressed with the food here as other reviewers are. Items I've tried, whether the sopas or some tacos, have come out dripping wet and drowning in sauce, and their taste just wasn't all that memorable. While I get that this might be a neighborhood favorite because it feels like a clean and "safe" space for gringos, there are so many more authentic and worthwhile experiences elsewhere in the city if you're craving some true Mexican food.

excerpts: Probably should have gotten the tacos.
tacos.author: Matt M.
tacos.review:
The staff was nice.
Meat was salty & had a few fat chunks. 
Wet burrito medium size
The "wet" red sauce too salty. Hot sauce & green sauce wasn't too great it was all over seasoned.
Probably should have gotten the tacos.
The chips were good.
I threw half the burrito away.

excerpts: I had some amazing shrimp tacos made with home made tortillas and fresh pico.
It's a charmingly small place with cozy seating.
The music gives it an authentic feel.
The salsa bar is excellent.
I'd like to say I've tried more of the menu but every time I eat here I just got straight for the shrimp tacos.
tacos.author: Justin G.
tacos.review: I happened upon this place while strolling the Marina. I had some amazing shrimp tacos made with home made tortillas and fresh pico. It's a charmingly small place with cozy seating. The music gives it an authentic feel. The salsa bar is excellent. I'd like to say I've tried more of the menu but every time I eat here I just got straight for the shrimp tacos.

excerpts: My friend and I got tacos
, I got camarones (shrimp)
and the tortilla was fresh + delicious!
The quality was also really good.
tacos.author: Denise R.
tacos.review:
TOMA is a little stop-in shop mostly to grab takeout or a quick bite, but it looks really clean and has a nice, simple menu.

My friend and I got tacos, I got camarones (shrimp) and the tortilla was fresh + delicious! The quality was also really good. I'd come back next time to try their sopes.

Also, I got the watermelon agua fresca, which was perfect - not too sweet and hit the spot.

excerpts: But in sure it's as good as their tacos.
Coming back soon!
Nice job TOMA.
tacos.author: Luis G.
tacos.review:
I ate at here on Friday night and I didn't think it was going to be this delicious! I had a steak taco and a Adobado. The Adobado was super good! My favorite for sure! Hand made tortillas made it even better. What topped it off was the Horchata! Horchata was on point! My gf is from Mexico and she definitely approves! This place is perfect for a lunch dinner or a late snack. I can't speak for their other food. But in sure it's as good as their tacos. Coming back soon! 
Nice job TOMA.

excerpts: Can't go wrong with the tacos especially on Barbacoa Fridays!
tacos.author: Richard R.
tacos.review:
Can't go wrong with the tacos especially on Barbacoa Fridays! There aren't to many places that make their corn tortillas in house plus all the ingredients are fresh with the meat made to order not sitting in a bin all day long. 

PS They started serving tamales on the weekend. Picked up a dozen last weekend.. Grub!

excerpts: Was very disappointed because the tacos were too thick and very soggy.
I got the vegetable and chicken tacos.
The fillings were very tasty but the thick and mushy corn tortilla was not pleasant to eat.
tacos.author: Jacqui C.
tacos.review: Was very disappointed because the tacos were too thick and very soggy. I got the vegetable and chicken tacos. The fillings were very tasty but the thick and mushy corn tortilla was not pleasant to eat. The chips were also not very good because it's those type of chips you get at movie theaters for nachos. blegh. Service was friendly and outdoor seating was nice. Not coming back here again though.

excerpts: Delicious food, amazing homemade tacos and kind staff.
Stumbled upon this place on a Saturday night-- great service, made to order, but came out super fast!
Highly recommend and would be delighted to return.
tacos.author: Suzy L.
tacos.review: Delicious food, amazing homemade tacos and kind staff. Stumbled upon this place on a Saturday night-- great service, made to order, but came out super fast! Highly recommend and would be delighted to return.

excerpts: Tiny hole in the wall, but great to pop in for a cold beer and fresh tacos on a hot day.
Soft taco shells are made in house and are thick and delicious.
tacos.author: Matt M.
tacos.review: Great spot.  Tiny hole in the wall, but great to pop in for a cold beer and fresh tacos on a hot day.  Soft taco shells are made in house and are thick and delicious.

excerpts: Pathetically I later found myself across the way filling up with more flavorful tacos at Taco Bell with a 2 minute wait and half the price.
tacos.author: Alexandra C.
tacos.review:
Good price under 3 bucks for a chicken taco.  The taco though was tiny and I found the chicken to be too dry.  Did like their small salsa toppings bar and the corn taco itself had some good flavor.  Overall found it to be a too tiny portion with too little chicken and flavor underwhelming. 
So take my review for what it is worth- I didn't splurge for the burrito, as everyone else was ordering, but this tiny taco wasn't worth the price or the annoying 25 minute take-out wait for 1 taco.  Pathetically I later found myself across the way filling up with more flavorful tacos at Taco Bell with a 2 minute wait and half the price.

excerpts: The guy making the tacos literally put my husband's flour tortilla on my corn tortillas and obviously I got sick.
Other than that it tasted super bland-
I wasn't a fan of the shrimp tacos or chicken and my husband thought his beef burrito wasn't good either
(he said the beef was way too chewy).
So many great taco places in Cali-
you can skip this one
tacos.author: Jessica F.
tacos.review: Wasn't a fan - at all. For some reason it came up on my "gluten free" search but the girl at counter had no idea what I meant even though she assured me it was gluten free. The guy making the tacos literally put my husband's flour tortilla on my corn tortillas and obviously I got sick. Other than that it tasted super bland- I wasn't a fan of the shrimp tacos or chicken and my husband thought his beef burrito wasn't good either (he said the beef was way too chewy). So many great taco places in Cali- you can skip this one

excerpts: I had the chicken tacos and they were delicious.
The tortilla is a little different than "normal" tortillas, but it was great!
tacos.author: Hazel M.
tacos.review: We came here right before we left for the airport. I had the chicken tacos and they were delicious.  The tortilla is a little different than "normal" tortillas, but it was great!

excerpts: had to take some tacos to go since it was so good.
I recommend going here.
tacos.author: Bryan P.
tacos.review: All I have to say is wow. This place exceeded my expectations. There are many Mexican places that taste pretty generic. But this one has so much flavor and taste authentic. The pricing isn't bad and the service is great. Definitely coming be here again. Ordered a carne asada super burrito it was delicious had to take some tacos to go since it was so good. I recommend going here.

excerpts: Delicious tacos!
The tacos are on fresh corn tortillas and topped with flavorful chicken.
Love this place.
tacos.author: Sophie M.
tacos.review: Delicious tacos! The tacos are on fresh corn tortillas and topped with flavorful chicken. Love this place.

excerpts: Loved the veggie burrito and tacos that we had.
The staff is so friendly and polite, fresh food and nice people - perfect.
tacos.author: Shamsher S.
tacos.review: Stopped for a late lunch, really good food and great music too! Loved the veggie burrito and tacos that we had. The staff is so friendly and polite, fresh food and nice people - perfect.

excerpts: Their tacos are a nice size as well.
The only bad part about this place is their carne asada is just super chewy.
Don't order the carne asada, get the Wednesday special -Carnitas!
Bomb!
tacos.author: Brooke F.
tacos.review: This spot has some really delicious salsas. It's probably my favorite thing about Toma. Their tacos are a nice size as well. The only bad part about this place is their carne asada is just super chewy. Don't order the carne asada, get the Wednesday special -Carnitas! Bomb!

excerpts: And then the tacos!
tacos.author: Marie-Louise O.
tacos.review: Amazing service with the sweetest girl taking our order! Recommended the barabquavo sort of a pulled pork bowl, looks amazing! Tastes better! And then the tacos! Got chips and guacamole and the salsa! Great food and a lovely time!

excerpts: the guy even gave my girlfriend and I free tacos and drinks!
Today was a totally different story-
probably won't return in the future.
tacos.author: J C.
tacos.review: I've been to this place twice. The first time I came, I had a good experience, but was a less than average time.  The chips for my nachos tasted like they were a week old!! The nachos were completely stale! I also had a burrito which was fine, nothing to get excited about. I came back to this place because the first time I thought  everything was good, the service was great- the guy even gave my girlfriend and I free tacos and drinks! Today was a totally different story- probably won't return in the future.

excerpts: And the tacos!!!
My mouth is watering thinking about them
tacos.author: Erika H.
tacos.review: Best Mexican food hands down!!! This will be a spot I will go to every time I come to San Francisco and I will be telling all my friends to go. I thought tortas were gross, until I tried theirs. And the tacos!!! My mouth is watering thinking about them

excerpts: Good solid tacos.
chicken mole (special), chicken and beef.
Pretty tasty stuff.
I can also attest for a group of 22 others.
Folks are really friendly and they knocked the order out pretty quickly.
Think of this as something between a taqueria and maybe something more upscale like Tacolicious nearby.
Fresh clean fare with friendly service?
Absolutely
tacos.author: Kim N.
tacos.review: It's good to see small mom and pop places do well. I had bought food for a whole slew of people doing work for a tv shoot. Their prep had started the night before and normally they'd have cooked their own family meal. So I decided to buy for them and take part myself. Good solid tacos. chicken mole (special), chicken and beef. Pretty tasty stuff. I can also attest for a group of 22 others. Folks are really friendly and they knocked the order out pretty quickly. Think of this as something between a taqueria and maybe something more upscale like Tacolicious nearby. Fresh clean fare with friendly service? Absolutely

excerpts: For the food, I would recommend the chicken burritos or tacos.
Those are my constant go-tos.
Squeeze some lime and put the mild red sauce on it
and it just tastes delicious.
Also, if you like mushrooms or squash, both choices are excellent and very flavorful.
I love mushrooms so sometimes I just get a mushroom burrito and some cantaloupe agua fresca and call it a day.
Speaking of their agua frescas, all the flavors I've ever tried are
so so soo good.
Cantaloupe, watermelon, pineapple and the horchata are all amazing and pair perfectly with the food.
tacos.author: Jessica L.
tacos.review:
TOMA is my favorite place to get my Mexican food fix.  I usually go at least once a week if not twice.  Their food is very fresh and clean which I like in Mexican food.  I'm not a fan of super greasy Mexican food that's dripping with oil.  The customer service is excellent too.  Everyone is extremely friendly and attentive.  

For the food, I would recommend the chicken burritos or tacos.  Those are my constant go-tos.  Squeeze some lime and put the mild red sauce on it and it just tastes delicious.  Also, if you like mushrooms or squash, both choices are excellent and very flavorful. I love mushrooms so sometimes I just get a mushroom burrito and some cantaloupe agua fresca and call it a day.  Speaking of their agua frescas, all the flavors I've ever tried are so so soo good.  Cantaloupe, watermelon, pineapple and the horchata are all amazing and pair perfectly with the food.  I definitely find myself craving the juices on those rare warm days in SF.

The other day I decided to try a chicken quesadilla with guacamole and sour cream and it was the best decision I made that week!  I love quesadillas with just cheese and chicken, but with the extras it was just unbelievably yummy.  Their quesadillas are huge too and I ate the whole thing in one sitting because it was that good.  I was very proud of myself that day.  

If you're ever in the Marina and craving Mexican food, definitely give this spot a try.  You won't be disappointed and I think you'll even walk away impressed by everything TOMA has to offer.  I know I am!

excerpts: I had the pork & carne asada tacos, which were so, so good.
Hub had the carne asada burrito.
The staff was super friendly and gave us a few suggestions when we asked.
I'd definitely come back here.
tacos.author: Megan B.
tacos.review: More of a lunch spot, but came here to grab a quick dinner before an event nearby. I had the pork & carne asada tacos, which were so, so good. Hub had the carne asada burrito. The staff was super friendly and gave us a few suggestions when we asked. I'd definitely come back here.

excerpts: Not a huge menu, but after tacos, burritos, and tortas
I'm not sure what else you need.
I wish they opened earlier for breakfast burritos on the weekend.
tacos.author: Nathan W.
tacos.review:
Solid and dependable option in the Marina. Not a huge menu, but after tacos, burritos, and tortas I'm not sure what else you need. I wish they opened earlier for breakfast burritos on the weekend.

Great salsa. Go for habanero. Just the right amount of kick. Glad they opened up.

excerpts: Sorry TOMA, maybe I will try your tacos or tortas!
tacos.author: Juliana K.
tacos.review:
I was looking forward to trying Toma when I noticed their impressive 4.5 stars on yelp, Toma has been calling my name for quite a while now. Being a Mexican food connoisseur, I was not very impressed. 

I ordered a carne asada burrito (which also contains rice, beans, cheese, and pico de gallo) and it was nothing special.  There are definitely better burrito options in the area, albeit I did really like their cantaloupe agua fresca!  They also have a salsa bar, and all of their salsas were extremely watery, which is not preferable.  However, most of them were really tasty!

Bottom line:  If I'm going to eat a carb-heavy burrito, it had better be good!  Sorry TOMA, maybe I will try your tacos or tortas!

excerpts: They have a small but complete menu with burritos, tacos and quesadillas.
They serve the meat eaters and veggie crowds as well, which is important to my husband who is a vegetarian.
He had their mushroom burrito and said it hit the spot.
I had the beef and chicken tacos, which were flavorful.
tacos.author: Natalie S.
tacos.review:
So glad Toma is here! My husband and I were so sad when Chilayo closed.  It was our go to Mexican place in our neighborhood.  Yes, there are a lot of other Mexican restaurants in the area, but all are a "scene". And sometimes you just want good, simple food.  Toma is it! They have a small but complete menu with burritos, tacos and quesadillas. They serve the meat eaters and veggie crowds as well, which is important to my husband who is a vegetarian.  He had their mushroom burrito and said it hit the spot.  I had the beef and chicken tacos, which were flavorful.  We also had a side of guacamole which tasted so fresh.  

Anyway, I'm glad they are nearby and can't wait to get my fix again soon!

excerpts: The tacos are to die for, they're made with hand made tortillas made to order, the tomatoes were super fresh and so were the other ingredients.
I had the torta most recently
and it was so good
I felt compelled to write a review!
Both times I came I was served by Junior who recommended some homemade salsa that really acted as the cherry on top of a five star affordable meal that is so uncommon in San Francisco
I can't wait to come back.
Great service!
Great location!
Great experience!
Do yourself a favor and ¡TOMA!
tacos.author: Josh R.
tacos.review:
Toma toma toma!  

My biggest complaint of growing up in sf is sh!%ty Mexican food.  Toma has restored my faith in good Mexican food in sf!  The tacos are to die for, they're made with hand made tortillas made to order, the tomatoes were super fresh and so were the other ingredients.  I had the torta most recently and it was so good I felt compelled to write a review!  Both times I came I was served by Junior who recommended some homemade salsa that really acted as the cherry on top of a five star affordable meal that is so uncommon in San Francisco I can't wait to come back.  Great service!  Great location!  Great experience!  Do yourself a favor and ¡TOMA!

excerpts: We tried the adobado, carne asada, pollo asado and mushroom tacos.
All had excellent seasoning, killer soft, tasty corn tortilla and spot on pico de gallo.
We also split an adobado burrito as well and it was on par with the tacos.
The tortilla was thin but chewy, which seems under executed at most places.
To top it all off, Izzy, one of the owners, was super polite and inviting.
We also split an adobado burrito as well and it was on par with the tacos.
The tortilla was thin but chewy, which seems under executed at most places.
To top it all off, Izzy, one of the owners, was super polite and inviting.
Long story short I'm not reaching far when I say that these are some of the best tacos on this side of the city and may keep us from wondering over to Tropisueno!
Hopefully other people taste the difference  between Toma and places like Mamacitas and Tacko and feel the same as we do.
Once that happens this place won't Benin their small take out location for long!
tacos.author: joe z.
tacos.review:
We've finally got a legitimate Mexican spot on our side of the city!  We tried the adobado, carne asada, pollo asado and mushroom tacos. All had excellent seasoning, killer soft, tasty corn tortilla and spot on pico de gallo.  We also split an adobado burrito as well and it was on par with the tacos. The tortilla was thin but chewy, which seems under executed at most places.  To top it all off, Izzy, one of the owners, was super polite and inviting. Good stuff. 

Long story short I'm not reaching far when I say that these are some of the best tacos on this side of the city and may keep us from wondering over to Tropisueno!  Hopefully other people taste the difference  between Toma and places like Mamacitas and Tacko and feel the same as we do. Once that happens this place won't Benin their small take out location for long!

excerpts: Love these tacos!!
They make homemade tortillas which are fluffy and delicious.
I have gotten the shrimp tacos a few times and absolutely love them.
A friend has tried their breakfast burrito and really liked it too.
I'm so glad I found this place as I'll be frequently stopping by for a quick dinner when I don't want to cook.
tacos.author: Stephanie B.
tacos.review: Love these tacos!! They make homemade tortillas which are fluffy and delicious. I have gotten the shrimp tacos a few times and absolutely love them. A friend has tried their breakfast burrito and really liked it too. I'm so glad I found this place as I'll be frequently stopping by for a quick dinner when I don't want to cook.

excerpts: Nachos, tacos and burritos....
This place absolutely knocks the basics out of the park.
tacos.author: Adam H.
tacos.review:
Nachos, tacos and burritos.... This place absolutely knocks the basics out of the park. Their tortillas are the freshest which makes all the difference in taste/texture.

Absolutely would recommend this to anyone.

excerpts: Savory tacos with unique toppings (i.e. mushroom, zucchini) - CHECK.
tacos.author: Sarath S.
tacos.review:
Handmade corn tortillas (yes, handmade!) - CHECK.
Savory tacos with unique toppings (i.e. mushroom, zucchini) - CHECK.
Fresh salsa bar with 4 tasty, original flavors - CHECK.

Best little joint in the Marina - CHECK, CHECK.

excerpts: Chicken tacos are delicious and the freshly made tortillas make them unique.
Delicious horchata as well, not too sweet or grainy.
Friendly staff.
tacos.author: Emma W.
tacos.review: A very solid Mexican restaurant. It's a small restaurant, but very nice and cozy. Chicken tacos are delicious and the freshly made tortillas make them unique. Delicious horchata as well, not too sweet or grainy. Friendly staff.

excerpts: The staff is very friendly and welcoming, but thay didn't really compensate for the boring tacos.
I had the mushroom and pork tacos, and they were just ok...a little bland.
tacos.author: Meredith M.
tacos.review:
Always great to have a new burrito spot in the neighborhood, and that's exactly what toma is. Perfect for burritos on the go, especially if you appreciate a home made tortilla. 

The staff is very friendly and welcoming, but thay didn't really compensate for the boring tacos. I had the mushroom and pork tacos, and they were just ok...a little bland. 

My boyfriend had tue carne asada burrito and it was very good!  We will probably come back for burritos :)

excerpts: Love the tortas, the burritos, and the fresh tortilla made a tacos.
tacos.author: David R.
tacos.review:
Absolutely. Love. This. Place.

Fresh, tasty and satisfying on every level. While mex has always been a challenge in the marina, this place brings some credibility to the area. And they deliver. Love the tortas, the burritos, and the fresh tortilla made a tacos. Everything is freshly cooked made-to-order and you can tell.

Definitely one of my favorites in the area and worth a stop for at least a taco/small bite, if not dinner.

excerpts: Best carne asada tacos in the area.
