I lived in Mex for some years and by far this place is the closest when it comes to Mexican food flavor.
Fresh and delicious !
tacos.author: Creta V.
tacos.review: Best carne asada tacos in the area. I lived in Mex for some years and by far this place is the closest when it comes to Mexican food flavor. Fresh and delicious !

excerpts: It's not just the tacos.
tacos.author: Tom D.
tacos.review: This is the best Mexican food I've found in the Cow Hollow/Marina area. Absolutely amazing. It's not just the tacos. The Fajita burritos are scrumptious. Don't look any further. Try it out. I usually stock on a few burritos and conquer them over the next couple of days. Nice people, too.

excerpts: Stopped in San Fran for lunch during a long road trip Had pork tacos at the recommendation of the cashier.
They were pretty cheap and tasted wonderful!
The horchata was also really good!
tacos.author: Wendy M.
tacos.review: Stopped in San Fran for lunch during a long road trip Had pork tacos at the recommendation of the cashier. They were pretty cheap and tasted wonderful! The horchata was also really good!

excerpts: Tortillas are fluffy and fresh, best tacos I've had in SF.
Plus the salsa verde, droooool!!
tacos.author: Tiffany C.
tacos.review: So delish!!! Tortillas are fluffy and fresh, best tacos I've had in SF. Plus the salsa verde, droooool!!

excerpts: Great chicken Tacos, friendly staff and tasty salsas.
Josh at the counter suggested I write a review and attempted to to up sale me a drink, thanks for the grub
tacos.author: Carl C.
tacos.review: Great chicken Tacos, friendly staff and tasty salsas. Josh at the counter suggested I write a review and attempted to to up sale me a drink, thanks for the grub

excerpts: Their burritos are alright but their tacos are good.
They're a bit pricey but its bearable.
tacos.author: Tina F.
tacos.review: Their burritos are alright but their tacos are good. They're a bit pricey but its bearable.

excerpts: I've ordered beef and pork tacos which were great!
A good place to satisfy cravings at a fair price!
tacos.author: Jaclyn N.
tacos.review: Small and clean restaurant. Nice and pretty quick service. I've ordered beef and pork tacos which were great! A good place to satisfy cravings at a fair price!

excerpts: The chicken tacos are unbelievable and the handmade corn tortillas cant be found anywhere else in SF.
I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!
tacos.author: Sean P.
tacos.review: Best Mexican food in the Marina! The chicken tacos are unbelievable and the handmade corn tortillas cant be found anywhere else in SF. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!

excerpts: I've only ever had the sopes, tacos, and burritos, but they always do an excellent job.
The service does take a little longer, but they really do just put that much more effort into the food.
The girl working at the counter was such a doll-she greeted every customer that came in with a smile and was also extremely helpful.
My first time there, I wasn't sure what to get.
tacos.author: Kristen M.
tacos.review:
I am a huge Mexican food fan and Toma is my favorite spot in the city.
I've only ever had the sopes, tacos, and burritos, but they always do an excellent job.
The service does take a little longer, but they really do just put that much more effort into the food.
The girl working at the counter was such a doll-she greeted every customer that came in with a smile and was also extremely helpful. My first time there, I wasn't sure what to get.  She recommended the champinones (mushroom) and asada burrito and it was delicious!  
Definitely eat here!

excerpts: Toma provided tasty tacos without the trip across town.
The carne asada was the biggest hit.
Get this!
The meat is perfectly seasoned, literally freshly chopped before your eyes, and sprinkled with fresh pico de gallo.
While the service isn't fast, I truly appreciate the fresh and home-made food.
Note:
small interior isn't good for eating in with a group.
We'll be back Toma!
tacos.author: Kim K.
tacos.review: Toma is a great new spot in the Marina.  We weren't in the mood to travel down to the Mission, but lucky for us Toma provided tasty tacos without the trip across town.  The carne asada was the biggest hit.  Get this!  The meat is perfectly seasoned, literally freshly chopped before your eyes, and sprinkled with fresh pico de gallo.  While the service isn't fast, I truly appreciate the fresh and home-made food.  Note: small interior isn't good for eating in with a group. We'll be back Toma!

excerpts: Utterly forgettable tacos.
Not one standout feature - spongey, soggy tortillas that fall apart in your hands, fatty chunks of under-seasoned meat (the carne asada), and bland salsas.
Do yourself a favor and skip this place in favor of Tacolicious for a far better experience just a block away.
tacos.author: Braden S.
tacos.review: Utterly forgettable tacos. Not one standout feature - spongey, soggy tortillas that fall apart in your hands, fatty chunks of under-seasoned meat (the carne asada), and bland salsas. Do yourself a favor and skip this place in favor of Tacolicious for a far better experience just a block away.

excerpts: get some tacos.. boomtown
tacos.author: Matt D.
tacos.review: This place is bomb, the food is fresh and prices are good. The owner's are chill ass dudes. get some tacos.. boomtown

excerpts: Nice little place for late night tacos, burritos, and other goodies.
High End ingredients and really cheap prices are easy on the taste buds and wallet.
tacos.author: Michael L.
tacos.review: Nice little place for late night tacos, burritos, and other goodies. High End ingredients and really cheap prices are easy on the taste buds and wallet.

excerpts: Their tacos were AMAZING!
Many of my guests texted me the next day asking where they were from.
The tortillas are particularly delicious.
I was nervous using a Marina Mexican place as I normally go to El Farlito, but I could not be more pleased.
Additionally, TOMA was a pleasure to work with and incredibly helpful / friendly.
Will definitely use them again!
tacos.author: arielle r.
tacos.review: I had Toma cater my birthday party at my apartment. Their tacos were AMAZING! Many of my guests texted me the next day asking where they were from. The tortillas are particularly delicious. I was nervous using a Marina Mexican place as I normally go to El Farlito, but I could not be more pleased. Additionally, TOMA was a pleasure to work with and incredibly helpful / friendly. Will definitely use them again!

excerpts: Tacos were only $2.95 and my full chili colorado dinner was under $10.
This is a new place and when the word gets out there will be a line out the door I bet.
tacos.author: Jeanne D.
tacos.review: I just discovered this great  little whole in the wall on Steiner between Chestnut and Lombard.  The chile colorado was delicious, just like my grandmother's, and hers was the best - full of flavor without being too hot.  Beans and rice were good and the tortillas were amazing - made fresh for each order.The ingredients were of good quality, more like Tacalicious or Mamacitas, just without the fancy setting. Good value.  Tacos were only $2.95 and my full chili colorado dinner was under $10.  This is a new place and when the word gets out there will be a line out the door I bet.

excerpts: The owner is super friendly and told me that they will be selling tacos late-night on weekend nights, which is awesome.
Definitely worth checking out-
I will be returning often!
tacos.author: Oscar Q.
tacos.review: Such a great new restaurant in the marina. The food is fresh and delicious- i highly recommend the veggie burrito with mushrooms. The owner is super friendly and told me that they will be selling tacos late-night on weekend nights, which is awesome. Definitely worth checking out- I will be returning often!

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the quesadillas with steak while I ordered the Sopes (I think it came with chicken), which was the first time I had the dish.
I love corn tortillas
so I was impressed the base, which was a thick corn tortilla that was perfectly soft yet toasted.
The sauce that it came with hardly had any flavor, but the sopes itself was sufficient without the sauce because the meat was well-seasoned and the shreddings were perfect.
I really enjoyed my boyfriend's quesadilla -- it had the perfect amount of cheese and meat, and the meat was perfectly seasoned.
sopes.author: Molly L.
sopes.review:
My boyfriend ordered the quesadillas with steak while I ordered the Sopes (I think it came with chicken), which was the first time I had the dish. I love corn tortillas so I was impressed the base, which was a thick corn tortilla that was perfectly soft yet toasted. The sauce that it came with hardly had any flavor, but the sopes itself was sufficient without the sauce because the meat was well-seasoned and the shreddings were perfect. I really enjoyed my boyfriend's quesadilla -- it had the perfect amount of cheese and meat, and the meat was perfectly seasoned. We were both definitely craving it the next day and were really glad that we found this little gem of a place near the place that we were staying. 

My only complaints are that it was a cold night and the restaurant was cold inside because there is a big window that was open and the door was wide open. Additionally, the wait was pretty long since they seemed to be caught up preparing a lot of phone orders, so that was also a bit annoying. I would suggest that you call ahead in order to save some time waiting, since everyone else seems to do that.

excerpts: The sopes de adobado taste really awesome
sopes.author: Alondra R.
sopes.review: This was the first place I've ate here in San Francisco, I can definitely say it's really really good ! The sopes de adobado taste really awesome

excerpts: Visited Toma tonight and enjoyed a burrito and my lady enjoyed their sopes.
Everything was really tasty!
sopes.author: Kristopher S.
sopes.review: Visited Toma tonight and enjoyed a burrito and my lady enjoyed their sopes. Everything was really tasty! We also had their guacamole, pico and chips. Flavor was on point, and the guy working the counter was really attentive and friendly. Definitely support these guys!

excerpts: I'd come back next time to try their sopes.
sopes.author: Denise R.
sopes.review:
TOMA is a little stop-in shop mostly to grab takeout or a quick bite, but it looks really clean and has a nice, simple menu.

My friend and I got tacos, I got camarones (shrimp) and the tortilla was fresh + delicious! The quality was also really good. I'd come back next time to try their sopes.

Also, I got the watermelon agua fresca, which was perfect - not too sweet and hit the spot.

excerpts: I like my carne asada with no fat and my sopes with carne asada
had none!
They were perfect and the coca cola in the bottle.... the best.
Best prices too
sopes.author: Brenda E.
sopes.review: Delicious food!! I like my carne asada with no fat and my sopes with carne asada had none! They were perfect and the coca cola in the bottle.... the best. Best prices too

excerpts: The chick behind me (who also informed me that my zipper was down, props to girl behind me) said the sopes are awesome.
sopes.author: Tina P.
sopes.review:
WOOOHOOO! No one does hand made tortillas anymore... made to order too! I'm not a chicken lover, but I did do one chicken taco and it was amazing! Everything is fresh and made to order. With so many food options, fresh gets major points. 

The chick behind me (who also informed me that my zipper was down, props to girl behind me) said the sopes are awesome.

Can't wait to go back!!! Just what the Marina was missing AND it's open late night.

excerpts: Their sopes with champiñones are really great-
creamy and well-cooked base and wonderfully seasoned mushrooms, with fresh lettuce.
The seven-year-old got seconds of the quesadilla, which is a nice treat.
sopes.author: Beatrice W.
sopes.review: I'll always be grateful because these guys very kindly let me and my babysitting charge stay at their outside seating while we were locked out of the house. Super friendly staff and great with kids. Their sopes with champiñones are really great- creamy and well-cooked base and wonderfully seasoned mushrooms, with fresh lettuce. The seven-year-old got seconds of the quesadilla, which is a nice treat.

excerpts: I've only ever had the sopes, tacos, and burritos, but they always do an excellent job.
The service does take a little longer, but they really do just put that much more effort into the food.
The girl working at the counter was such a doll-she greeted every customer that came in with a smile and was also extremely helpful.
My first time there, I wasn't sure what to get.
sopes.author: Kristen M.
sopes.review:
I am a huge Mexican food fan and Toma is my favorite spot in the city.
I've only ever had the sopes, tacos, and burritos, but they always do an excellent job.
The service does take a little longer, but they really do just put that much more effort into the food.
The girl working at the counter was such a doll-she greeted every customer that came in with a smile and was also extremely helpful. My first time there, I wasn't sure what to get.  She recommended the champinones (mushroom) and asada burrito and it was delicious!  
Definitely eat here!

excerpts: Get the sopes!!!
Best thing I've ever eaten!
Or get anything else
it's all equally as good!
but once you try the home made sopes or tortillas
sopes.author: Scott C.
sopes.review: Get the sopes!!!  Best thing I've ever eaten!  Or get anything else it's all equally as good!  They could upgrade their chips but once you try the home made sopes or tortillas you'll forget all about the shitty chips.  Good salsa as well and finally a take out mexi food place in the marina!

excerpts: My friends enjoyed their tortas, quesadillas, and nachos, but it wasn't mind blowing and this is somewhere we wouldn't go out of our way to get or eat at if we were in the area.
tortas.author: Carol L.
tortas.review:
I'm a little surprised by how well rated this place is. Firstly, Toma is such a tiny store. There is honestly only enough room inside for 6 - 8 people to stand/sit around. They do have a couple small spots outside to sit at. 

Our food came out pretty slowly and not in any type of order. People who ordered before me got their food way after I did. They also don't fill the cups all the way in their drinks which is kinda disappointing considering that it's not cheap.

I got the carne asada bowl, which while good was kind of small if you don't pay to get extra toppings. My friends enjoyed their tortas, quesadillas, and nachos, but it wasn't mind blowing and this is somewhere we wouldn't go out of our way to get or eat at if we were in the area.

Pro-tip: Check into Yelp for a free bag of chips!

excerpts: My friend had the barbeqou tortas.
tortas.author: Angeles W.
tortas.review:
Don't let the hole in the wall size of this spot turn you off.  Place an order and take it back home or to your car.  

I had the pork burrito with both veggie mixes.
My friend had the barbeqou tortas.

Both were perfect. 
Spot-on flavor.  Perfect dinner portions. Fresh. Vibrant. Salsa bar to complement. 

Eat here. Thank me later.

excerpts: Their tortas are good and burritos are decent.
Their salsa bar is a fun perk as I love to drench my food in salsas caseras.
The service is always great with their friendly cashiers.
My husband likes their beer options and enjoys the small corner taqueria style of the restaurant.
tortas.author: Cindy G.
tortas.review: If you are in the neighborhood on a Monday you definitely should try their chile colorado special in a bowl, very tasty! Their tortas are good and burritos are decent. Their salsa bar is a fun perk as I love to drench my food in salsas caseras. The service is always great with their friendly cashiers. My husband likes their beer options and enjoys the small corner taqueria style of the restaurant.

excerpts: I thought tortas were gross, until I tried theirs.
tortas.author: Erika H.
tortas.review: Best Mexican food hands down!!! This will be a spot I will go to every time I come to San Francisco and I will be telling all my friends to go. I thought tortas were gross, until I tried theirs. And the tacos!!! My mouth is watering thinking about them

excerpts:
However, DO GET THE TORTAS. 
My fav is the chicken torta. 
It is amazing and warm and toasty and savory and sure to make you happy.
tortas.author: Tania C.
tortas.review:
Okay so this place is hit or miss. I work nearby so I had the chance to come here 3 days in a row basically (because of a paypal coupon).
When people think Mexican food, I feel the first thing they think of is burritos. Word of advice: DON'T GET THE BURRITOS. They will NOT satisfy you. However, DO GET THE TORTAS. 
My fav is the chicken torta. It is amazing and warm and toasty and savory and sure to make you happy.
The burritos are dry and if you get carne asada it will be dry and tough and cut far too big. The chicken burritos weren't any better. Chicken was good but the rest was dry. 
In conclusion, get the chicken torta. You will not regret it. 


UPDATE: MY TORTA BREAD WAS MOLDY. SO DISAPPOINTED

excerpts: Not a huge menu, but after tacos, burritos, and tortas
I'm not sure what else you need.
I wish they opened earlier for breakfast burritos on the weekend.
tortas.author: Nathan W.
tortas.review:
Solid and dependable option in the Marina. Not a huge menu, but after tacos, burritos, and tortas I'm not sure what else you need. I wish they opened earlier for breakfast burritos on the weekend.

Great salsa. Go for habanero. Just the right amount of kick. Glad they opened up.

excerpts: Sorry TOMA, maybe I will try your tacos or tortas!
tortas.author: Juliana K.
tortas.review:
I was looking forward to trying Toma when I noticed their impressive 4.5 stars on yelp, Toma has been calling my name for quite a while now. Being a Mexican food connoisseur, I was not very impressed. 

I ordered a carne asada burrito (which also contains rice, beans, cheese, and pico de gallo) and it was nothing special.  There are definitely better burrito options in the area, albeit I did really like their cantaloupe agua fresca!  They also have a salsa bar, and all of their salsas were extremely watery, which is not preferable.  However, most of them were really tasty!

Bottom line:  If I'm going to eat a carb-heavy burrito, it had better be good!  Sorry TOMA, maybe I will try your tacos or tortas!

excerpts: Love the tortas, the burritos, and the fresh tortilla made a tacos.
tortas.author: David R.
tortas.review:
Absolutely. Love. This. Place.

Fresh, tasty and satisfying on every level. While mex has always been a challenge in the marina, this place brings some credibility to the area. And they deliver. Love the tortas, the burritos, and the fresh tortilla made a tacos. Everything is freshly cooked made-to-order and you can tell.

Definitely one of my favorites in the area and worth a stop for at least a taco/small bite, if not dinner.

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the quesadillas with steak while I ordered the Sopes (I think it came with chicken), which was the first time I had the dish.
I love corn tortillas
so I was impressed the base, which was a thick corn tortilla that was perfectly soft yet toasted.
The sauce that it came with hardly had any flavor, but the sopes itself was sufficient without the sauce because the meat was well-seasoned and the shreddings were perfect.
I really enjoyed my boyfriend's quesadilla -- it had the perfect amount of cheese and meat, and the meat was perfectly seasoned.
quesadillas.author: Molly L.
quesadillas.review:
My boyfriend ordered the quesadillas with steak while I ordered the Sopes (I think it came with chicken), which was the first time I had the dish. I love corn tortillas so I was impressed the base, which was a thick corn tortilla that was perfectly soft yet toasted. The sauce that it came with hardly had any flavor, but the sopes itself was sufficient without the sauce because the meat was well-seasoned and the shreddings were perfect. I really enjoyed my boyfriend's quesadilla -- it had the perfect amount of cheese and meat, and the meat was perfectly seasoned. We were both definitely craving it the next day and were really glad that we found this little gem of a place near the place that we were staying. 

My only complaints are that it was a cold night and the restaurant was cold inside because there is a big window that was open and the door was wide open. Additionally, the wait was pretty long since they seemed to be caught up preparing a lot of phone orders, so that was also a bit annoying. I would suggest that you call ahead in order to save some time waiting, since everyone else seems to do that.

excerpts: My friends enjoyed their tortas, quesadillas, and nachos, but it wasn't mind blowing and this is somewhere we wouldn't go out of our way to get or eat at if we were in the area.
quesadillas.author: Carol L.
quesadillas.review:
I'm a little surprised by how well rated this place is. Firstly, Toma is such a tiny store. There is honestly only enough room inside for 6 - 8 people to stand/sit around. They do have a couple small spots outside to sit at. 

Our food came out pretty slowly and not in any type of order. People who ordered before me got their food way after I did. They also don't fill the cups all the way in their drinks which is kinda disappointing considering that it's not cheap.

I got the carne asada bowl, which while good was kind of small if you don't pay to get extra toppings. My friends enjoyed their tortas, quesadillas, and nachos, but it wasn't mind blowing and this is somewhere we wouldn't go out of our way to get or eat at if we were in the area.

Pro-tip: Check into Yelp for a free bag of chips!

excerpts: The Quesadillas are great...
quesadillas.author: Lorenzo M.
quesadillas.review: Amazing food, very friendly workers!!! Perfect! I was in San Francisco for 10 days with my student group from Germany!! We were there a couple times. The Quesadillas are great...

excerpts: I usually get the quesadillas de maiz and it's my go-to for lunch!
quesadillas.author: Lexi T.
quesadillas.review:
I've been here several times during my lunch breaks. The cashiers are super friendly, and the food is made fairly quickly and is really delicious. I usually get the quesadillas de maiz and it's my go-to for lunch!

Recently discovered that they have online ordering, which is super convenient for those who have shorter lunch breaks!

excerpts: Their quesadillas are alright, but their burrritos are very good.
quesadillas.author: Neil P.
quesadillas.review:
I love the salsa bar.

The championes, or mushroom one is the best option. Their quesadillas are alright, but their burrritos are very good.

Make sure to check in everytime you go for free chips!

excerpts: Other folks got quesadillas
quesadillas.author: Cassy H.
quesadillas.review:
Toma is a tiny, tiny spot. Probably can't seat more than 15 people or so. Definitely a to-go kind of place. 

I ordered a steak bowl - the steak was pretty good. I wish the portion was bigger though (maybe because I was hungry). Other folks got quesadillas and I think it was alright for them, but probably have had better ones in the Mission or elsewhere. 

Overall, a solid place to go if you want a quick and cheap bite (well, relatively cheaper compared to the other food options in this neighborhood). 

(50/100)

excerpts: Also had the corn quesadillas with mushrooms, which were pretty tasty--the fish is definitely the star of the show.
Great salsas and nice enough seating if it's not too busy.
Would come back if I were in the area.
quesadillas.author: Amber H.
quesadillas.review: Pretty tasty little taco place, with delicious fish tacos. A little salty (but I love salt, so nbd for me), but the flavors were great. Also had the corn quesadillas with mushrooms, which were pretty tasty--the fish is definitely the star of the show. Great salsas and nice enough seating if it's not too busy. Would come back if I were in the area.

excerpts: We all enjoyed our burritos and quesadillas - great flavor especially the carne asada.
The orders came out timely and the modifications we made to them were perfect.
We all felt great afterwards for having such big burritos!
The owner was there today and he was super friendly and attentive, there's definitely a pride in ownership here and we will all be returning!!!
quesadillas.author: Jasmine C.
quesadillas.review: My friends and I ate here today for lunch and it was great! We all enjoyed our burritos and quesadillas - great flavor especially the carne asada. The orders came out timely and the modifications we made to them were perfect. We all felt great afterwards for having such big burritos! The owner was there today and he was super friendly and attentive, there's definitely a pride in ownership here and we will all be returning!!!

excerpts: I love quesadillas with just cheese and chicken, but with the extras it was just unbelievably yummy.
Their quesadillas are huge too
and I ate the whole thing in one sitting because it was that good.
quesadillas.author: Jessica L.
quesadillas.review:
TOMA is my favorite place to get my Mexican food fix.  I usually go at least once a week if not twice.  Their food is very fresh and clean which I like in Mexican food.  I'm not a fan of super greasy Mexican food that's dripping with oil.  The customer service is excellent too.  Everyone is extremely friendly and attentive.  

For the food, I would recommend the chicken burritos or tacos.  Those are my constant go-tos.  Squeeze some lime and put the mild red sauce on it and it just tastes delicious.  Also, if you like mushrooms or squash, both choices are excellent and very flavorful. I love mushrooms so sometimes I just get a mushroom burrito and some cantaloupe agua fresca and call it a day.  Speaking of their agua frescas, all the flavors I've ever tried are so so soo good.  Cantaloupe, watermelon, pineapple and the horchata are all amazing and pair perfectly with the food.  I definitely find myself craving the juices on those rare warm days in SF.

The other day I decided to try a chicken quesadilla with guacamole and sour cream and it was the best decision I made that week!  I love quesadillas with just cheese and chicken, but with the extras it was just unbelievably yummy.  Their quesadillas are huge too and I ate the whole thing in one sitting because it was that good.  I was very proud of myself that day.  

If you're ever in the Marina and craving Mexican food, definitely give this spot a try.  You won't be disappointed and I think you'll even walk away impressed by everything TOMA has to offer.  I know I am!

excerpts: They have a small but complete menu with burritos, tacos and quesadillas.
They serve the meat eaters and veggie crowds as well, which is important to my husband who is a vegetarian.
He had their mushroom burrito and said it hit the spot.
I had the beef and chicken tacos, which were flavorful.
quesadillas.author: Natalie S.
quesadillas.review:
So glad Toma is here! My husband and I were so sad when Chilayo closed.  It was our go to Mexican place in our neighborhood.  Yes, there are a lot of other Mexican restaurants in the area, but all are a "scene". And sometimes you just want good, simple food.  Toma is it! They have a small but complete menu with burritos, tacos and quesadillas. They serve the meat eaters and veggie crowds as well, which is important to my husband who is a vegetarian.  He had their mushroom burrito and said it hit the spot.  I had the beef and chicken tacos, which were flavorful.  We also had a side of guacamole which tasted so fresh.  

Anyway, I'm glad they are nearby and can't wait to get my fix again soon!

excerpts: Their quesadillas are light and not too greasy and their prices are great!
quesadillas.author: Heide B.
quesadillas.review: The guys who work there are awesome and the service is fast and efficient. Toma is my go-to Mexican restaurant. Their quesadillas are light and not too greasy and their prices are great!

excerpts: , we ordered 3 tacos - carne asada, adobado, and mahi mahi.
Man these were so good!!!
My favorite was definitely the mahi mahi!
adobado.author: Jenny E.
adobado.review: While waiting for a dinner reservation I stopped by Toma to try some tacos, because why not?! It smelled so delicious outside I had to go in, we ordered 3 tacos - carne asada, adobado, and mahi mahi. Man these were so good!!! My favorite was definitely the mahi mahi! At almost $4 a taco, it's not the cheapest option in the city, but I got delicious tacos and great service in a nice part of town so I'm not complaining.

excerpts: while I enjoyed the thick corn tortilla and the well seasoned Adobado - I don't think I will go out my way to order delivery from them again.
adobado.author: Jessica T.
adobado.review:
I love Mexican spots that offer up organic meat. Toma sources their meats from Golden Gate Company and you can taste the freshness in each bite.

I sampled some of their tacos today and while I enjoyed the thick corn tortilla and the well seasoned Adobado - I don't think I will go out my way to order delivery from them again. 

Their guacamole was fairly tasteless and outside of the delightful tortilla shell - I was not overly impressed with my meal.

If you're looking for fresh organic Mexican food - I recommend sticking to Don Pistos or Nopalito.

Trust.

excerpts: Got asada, adobado (pork) and mahi mahi.
All three meats were really good.
The tortilla was one of the best (non-traditional semi-thick and floury)
adobado.author: Joshua F.
adobado.review:
A tad pricey but definitely good eating.

Got asada, adobado (pork) and mahi mahi. All three meats were really good. The tortilla was one of the best (non-traditional semi-thick and floury) I've had.

The tortilla is probably why those who order through a delivery service do not like their meal. I can totally see the tortilla going bad if it's not eaten within 5 minutes of being made.

Not "authentic" but better than most. It fits perfectly right into the Marina District's vibe. It's definitely on my radar and my next stop if I'm craving tacos around the Marina.

excerpts: The sopes de adobado taste really awesome
adobado.author: Alondra R.
adobado.review: This was the first place I've ate here in San Francisco, I can definitely say it's really really good ! The sopes de adobado taste really awesome

excerpts: Do yourself a favour and try the adobado (pork) burrito fajita style.
adobado.author: Ryan R.
adobado.review: One of the most underrated burrito spots in town. Do yourself a favour and try the adobado (pork) burrito fajita style.

excerpts: I had a steak taco and a Adobado.
The Adobado was super good!
My favorite for sure!
Hand made tortillas made it even better.
What topped it off was the Horchata!
Horchata was on point!
My gf is from Mexico and she definitely approves!
This place is perfect for a lunch dinner or a late snack.
I can't speak for their other food.
adobado.author: Luis G.
adobado.review:
I ate at here on Friday night and I didn't think it was going to be this delicious! I had a steak taco and a Adobado. The Adobado was super good! My favorite for sure! Hand made tortillas made it even better. What topped it off was the Horchata! Horchata was on point! My gf is from Mexico and she definitely approves! This place is perfect for a lunch dinner or a late snack. I can't speak for their other food. But in sure it's as good as their tacos. Coming back soon! 
Nice job TOMA.

excerpts: The adobado was chewy and not too memorable.
Meh.
adobado.author: Shaymaa M.
adobado.review: The shell of the taco wasn't great, they put tomato instead of cilantro and onion, and they didn't have carnitas when I went. They do give a large side of guac so that's in their favor. The adobado was chewy and not too memorable. Meh.

excerpts: I usually get adobado, but every other meat I've tried is great too.
adobado.author: Matt N.
adobado.review: I work around the corner and have tried all the Mexican places in the area--by far Toma is always the best. I grew up in so-cal so I'm pretty spoiled with unbeatable mom and pop taquerias at every corner. Toma always has super fresh ingredients, delicious salsa options (love the mild red, would buy by the gallon if possible), and ridiculously tasty marinated and freshly grilled meat! I usually get adobado, but every other meat I've tried is great too. The breakfast burritos are excellent as well. I get the ham and egg breakfast burrito with potatoes, add avocado and drench with the red mild sauce. Mmmmmm

excerpts: We tried the adobado, carne asada, pollo asado and mushroom tacos.
All had excellent seasoning, killer soft, tasty corn tortilla and spot on pico de gallo.
We also split an adobado burrito as well and it was on par with the tacos.
The tortilla was thin but chewy, which seems under executed at most places.
To top it all off, Izzy, one of the owners, was super polite and inviting.
We also split an adobado burrito as well and it was on par with the tacos.
The tortilla was thin but chewy, which seems under executed at most places.
To top it all off, Izzy, one of the owners, was super polite and inviting.
Long story short I'm not reaching far when I say that these are some of the best tacos on this side of the city and may keep us from wondering over to Tropisueno!
Hopefully other people taste the difference  between Toma and places like Mamacitas and Tacko and feel the same as we do.
Once that happens this place won't Benin their small take out location for long!
adobado.author: joe z.
adobado.review:
We've finally got a legitimate Mexican spot on our side of the city!  We tried the adobado, carne asada, pollo asado and mushroom tacos. All had excellent seasoning, killer soft, tasty corn tortilla and spot on pico de gallo.  We also split an adobado burrito as well and it was on par with the tacos. The tortilla was thin but chewy, which seems under executed at most places.  To top it all off, Izzy, one of the owners, was super polite and inviting. Good stuff. 

Long story short I'm not reaching far when I say that these are some of the best tacos on this side of the city and may keep us from wondering over to Tropisueno!  Hopefully other people taste the difference  between Toma and places like Mamacitas and Tacko and feel the same as we do. Once that happens this place won't Benin their small take out location for long!

excerpts: May have been the best quesadilla with calabacitas I have had.
Perfect meal after a long walk along the water.
If/when I am back in San Francisco, I will be back!
calabacitas.author: Alex E.
calabacitas.review: May have been the best quesadilla with calabacitas I have had. Perfect meal after a long walk along the water. If/when I am back in San Francisco, I will be back!

excerpts: Calabacitas burrito with grilled squash, zucchini, tomatoes and onion was great.
Extra black beans.
calabacitas.author: Jason B.
calabacitas.review:
Too much.

Wish I was referring to the food. Calabacitas burrito with grilled squash, zucchini, tomatoes and onion was great. Extra black beans. Lettuce instead of cheese.

Flour tortillas are your only option.

Great indeed. But $7.50 great? Not so much.

Other options might be better. All meat comes from Golden Gate Meat Company which certainly justifies a higher price. But for veggies only?

Way too much.

excerpts: I have had burritos and chips and guacamole on my lunch breaks but my newest favorite is the bowl featured below with black beans, Guac, and the calabacitas veggie option (both are great by the way), and topped with fresh limes and hot sauce complimentary for customers to grab.
If you feel like a big spender, try the Horchata, it's the perfect amount of sweet.
calabacitas.author: Jasmine W.
calabacitas.review: Always a good meal here, and love sitting and talking to whoever is working the register and cooking my food! I'm a vegetarian and I switch it up and my boyfriend swears my there carne asada! It is a small place so very easy to miss off of Steiner, in between a parking garage and Barney's, but trust you do not want to miss it. I have had burritos and chips and guacamole on my lunch breaks but my newest favorite is the bowl featured below with black beans, Guac, and the calabacitas veggie option (both are great by the way), and topped with fresh limes and hot sauce complimentary for customers to grab. If you feel like a big spender, try the Horchata, it's the perfect amount of sweet.

excerpts: We tried the quesadilla de Maiz, which is excellent, and their Champinones (filled with sauteed mushroom) is blissful.
The bowls are good but felt basic.
Still a good spot to have a quick bite in a relatively less crowded area of San Francisco.
champinones.author: Alex H.
champinones.review: Coming from LA and NJ, the food selections seem standard but a bit pricey -- but the food is still of good quality. We tried the quesadilla de Maiz, which is excellent, and their Champinones (filled with sauteed mushroom) is blissful. The bowls are good but felt basic. Still a good spot to have a quick bite in a relatively less crowded area of San Francisco.

excerpts: Their champinones burrito (mushroom and poblano pepper) is a refreshingly different version of the vegetarian burrito, and is delicious.
Their meat selections are always very tender, fresh, and traditionally prepared.
Carne asada and chicken mole are two of my favorites.
champinones.author: Martha D.
champinones.review: Simply amazing Mexican food. I have frequented TOMA since they moved into the Marina, and have NEVER been let down. Their champinones burrito (mushroom and poblano pepper) is a refreshingly different version of the vegetarian burrito, and is delicious. Their meat selections are always very tender, fresh, and traditionally prepared. Carne asada and chicken mole are two of my favorites. They also serve three different breakfast burritos, which I frequently crave. This place puts to shame many of the infamous Mission District taquerias. Do yourself a favor- stop reading and get over there.

excerpts: She recommended the champinones (mushroom) and asada burrito
and it was delicious!
Definitely eat here!
champinones.author: Kristen M.
champinones.review:
I am a huge Mexican food fan and Toma is my favorite spot in the city.
I've only ever had the sopes, tacos, and burritos, but they always do an excellent job.
The service does take a little longer, but they really do just put that much more effort into the food.
The girl working at the counter was such a doll-she greeted every customer that came in with a smile and was also extremely helpful. My first time there, I wasn't sure what to get.  She recommended the champinones (mushroom) and asada burrito and it was delicious!  
Definitely eat here!

excerpts: No salsa, guacamole or sour cream.
I ordered take out and this might have caused it.
Order in person to make sure this doesn't happen to you.
sour cream.author: Moore H.
sour cream.review: Dry burrito. No salsa, guacamole or sour cream. I ordered take out and this might have caused it. Order in person to make sure this doesn't happen to you.

excerpts: Sour cream, gauc, cheese is all extra which I thought was crazy!
But the servings are good and there's free salsa!
sour cream.author: Miguel E.
sour cream.review:
Food is great here and reasonable price for being in the Marina. They fry their burritos and add sweet peppers and onions by default so you might wanna tell them before hand. Sour cream, gauc, cheese is all extra which I thought was crazy! But the servings are good and there's free salsa! 
PRO TIP: don't get any of the sides on "the side" they cost extra and if you check in at the place you get FREE CHIPS!

excerpts: No cheese included, but you can add it (or guacamole or sour cream) for a charge.
sour cream.author: Liz G.
sour cream.review:
The food at Toma is so fresh and flavorful - I didn't even miss having the cheese in my burrito bowl! 

I dropped in for lunch to-go today, and my inner monologue was having a real struggle between choosing a burrito, or the burrito bowl. Bad Day Liz was telling me hefty burrito, but Bridesmaid-Dress-in-Two-Weeks Liz said go for the burrito bowl. Dress Liz won out, and I was not disappointed in what I was given!

The pollo asado (chicken) burrito bowl was big in flavor and the size was perfectly portioned. Grilled chicken breast, romaine lettuce, about 1/2 cup each Mexican rice and black beans. No cheese included, but you can add it (or guacamole or sour cream) for a charge. It honestly didn't need more dressing up than two scoops of fresh salsa from their salsa bar! 

Everything was made to order, hot and fresh. The people working there were nice as well. Can't wait to make another lunch break stop sometime soon!

excerpts: It kinda pricy if you want to add guacamole and/or sour cream for the burrito since it doesnt come with it.
I guess its an okay price for the marina district.
But of course you can get their free sauce from their sauce booth area.
sour cream.author: Julie N.
sour cream.review:
Got their chicken burrito with guacamole(which cost an extra $1 points f you want to add the guacamole) to go. Wasnt too busy so was able to get my food within 10 minutes or less. The taste of burrito was average. Decent size. It could get you full if you eat the whole thing.
 
Small place. But they do have sitting area if you want to dine in.

It kinda pricy if you want to add guacamole and/or sour cream for the burrito since it doesnt come with it. I guess its an okay price for the marina district. But of course you can get their free sauce from their sauce booth area.

excerpts: The burrito came with refried beans, rice, sour cream, guac and chicken.
The ingredients were really fresh and tasted similar to a mission-style burrito.
sour cream.author: Allison D.
sour cream.review: Ordered a chicken burrito and chips with guac for delivery today. The burrito came with refried beans, rice, sour cream, guac and chicken. The ingredients were really fresh and tasted similar to a mission-style burrito. The chips and guac are also a really good deal! Chips are a little salty but they gave you a huge thing of fresh guac for only $4. Also points for a delivery around 45 minutes, which is hard to come by in the city. Breakfast burrito will be my next try here!

excerpts:
So if you wanted to add guacamole and/or sour cream to your burrito or taco you would only be able to add one and would not be able to add something like chips. 
In addition, they need to read the tickets on GrubHub orders because half of our order was incorrect. 
Would have been four stars if they had not blown the order so badly.
sour cream.author: Alex A.
sour cream.review:
The food was very good.    The execution was sorely lacking. 
Their GrubHub options leave it so that on any dish ordered you may only pick one thing to add to it. So if you wanted to add guacamole and/or sour cream to your burrito or taco you would only be able to add one and would not be able to add something like chips. 
In addition, they need to read the tickets on GrubHub orders because half of our order was incorrect. 
Would have been four stars if they had not blown the order so badly.

excerpts: I don't like that things such as sour cream and guacamole
are extra - the bit on the overhead menu which says this is obscured from easy view, and you are offered them as if they were included.
That's half a star removed.
I particularly don't like that they expect minimum tips of 15% for service when there is no service.
That's another half star removed, making three in total.
sour cream.author: Norman B.
sour cream.review: Torn between 3 and 4 stars.  I quite like the food - solid four stars for a takeaway.  Nothing special but perfectly good.  I don't like that things such as sour cream and guacamole are extra - the bit on the overhead menu which says this is obscured from easy view, and you are offered them as if they were included.  That's half a star removed.  I particularly don't like that they expect minimum tips of 15% for service when there is no service.  That's another half star removed, making three in total.

excerpts: Whether it is guac and sour cream in our burrito bowls or forgetting to add salsa with the chips ( and really salsa in general.
When you order mexican you expect salsa.
Should be a given.)
I also don't get how they make their own tortillas but have store bought chips?
I keep going back because the meat and homemade tortillas.
And would love to give this place 5 stars if they picked their delivery game up.
sour cream.author: Mark M.
sour cream.review:
This place is great. We order from here about once a month for delivery. We have tried all the Mexican places in the area and TOMA serves the best meat. Their chicken and steak are what should get this place 5 stars...but... 

Where they can pick it up a bit is on their delivery. Every time, at least one item is always missing. Whether it is guac and sour cream in our burrito bowls or forgetting to add salsa with the chips ( and really salsa in general. When you order mexican you expect salsa. Should be a given.) I also don't get how they make their own tortillas but have store bought chips? I keep going back because the meat and homemade tortillas. And would love to give this place 5 stars if they picked their delivery game up.

excerpts: The other day I decided to try a chicken quesadilla with guacamole and sour cream and it was the best decision I made that week!
sour cream.author: Jessica L.
sour cream.review:
TOMA is my favorite place to get my Mexican food fix.  I usually go at least once a week if not twice.  Their food is very fresh and clean which I like in Mexican food.  I'm not a fan of super greasy Mexican food that's dripping with oil.  The customer service is excellent too.  Everyone is extremely friendly and attentive.  

For the food, I would recommend the chicken burritos or tacos.  Those are my constant go-tos.  Squeeze some lime and put the mild red sauce on it and it just tastes delicious.  Also, if you like mushrooms or squash, both choices are excellent and very flavorful. I love mushrooms so sometimes I just get a mushroom burrito and some cantaloupe agua fresca and call it a day.  Speaking of their agua frescas, all the flavors I've ever tried are so so soo good.  Cantaloupe, watermelon, pineapple and the horchata are all amazing and pair perfectly with the food.  I definitely find myself craving the juices on those rare warm days in SF.

The other day I decided to try a chicken quesadilla with guacamole and sour cream and it was the best decision I made that week!  I love quesadillas with just cheese and chicken, but with the extras it was just unbelievably yummy.  Their quesadillas are huge too and I ate the whole thing in one sitting because it was that good.  I was very proud of myself that day.  

If you're ever in the Marina and craving Mexican food, definitely give this spot a try.  You won't be disappointed and I think you'll even walk away impressed by everything TOMA has to offer.  I know I am!

excerpts: Plus it costs extra to add sour cream and guacamole.
sour cream.author: Tiffany Y.
sour cream.review:
Burritos are gigantic and the basic meats are good (I've tried chicken and pork). Wasn't a huge fan of their barbacoa, which is one of their specials, but their chicken mole (tues special) is to die for. 

Pretty expensive for a burrito with ordinary offerings of rice, beans, meat, and pico. Plus it costs extra to add sour cream and guacamole. But if you're in pac heights/the marina, you're not gonna find much cheaper or a better price-to-food ratio (again, burritos are huge). 

No more than 4 seats indoors and a couple of seats outside. The guy behind the counter who does the lunch shift is really helpful (will offer you samples) and friendly.

excerpts: Great place to go to at night if you got the munchies, but dining in is not recommended; I really don't recall any chairs or tables (correct me if I'm wrong), Price is just right if you order what is on the menu, but when you add basic necessities like; guacamole, sour cream, etc.
The bill will add up, and a $8 burrito will end up $187 (exaggeration).
The food and the way it is served is decent and unique, meaning; hand made tortilla is fluffy, and is completely different from your typical take out burrito place.
Also,  they make and cook everything when ordered, nothing is pre-made.
Of course, that comes at  the cost of ridiculously, ridiculously long wait times.
Great place to taste the difference, other than that
, its just another burrito take out joint that happens to open after last call.
sour cream.author: Wayne L.
sour cream.review:
Great place to go to at night if you got the munchies, but dining in is not recommended; I really don't recall any chairs or tables (correct me if I'm wrong), Price is just right if you order what is on the menu, but when you add basic necessities like; guacamole, sour cream, etc. The bill will add up, and a $8 burrito will end up $187 (exaggeration).    
  The food and the way it is served is decent and unique, meaning; hand made tortilla is fluffy, and is completely different from your typical take out burrito place. Also,  they make and cook everything when ordered, nothing is pre-made. Of course, that comes at  the cost of ridiculously, ridiculously long wait times. 
  Great place to taste the difference, other than that, its just another burrito take out joint that happens to open after last call.

excerpts: First of all, I didn't know you had to ask for sour cream and guac separately and pay extra.
Most taquerias just automatically put all that stuff in there.
Other than that the food was pretty good.
sour cream.author: Melissa M.
sour cream.review: First of all, I didn't know you had to ask for sour cream and guac separately and pay extra. Most taquerias just automatically put all that stuff in there. Other than that the food was pretty good. 30$ for 2 burritos and 2 drinks. Would come back, just need to read the menu a little clearer.

excerpts: Had a chicken taco with guacamole and sour cream, utterly delishious.....and the watermelon drink was lovely.
Highly recommended.
sour cream.author: Eda K.
sour cream.review: Loved this place. The freshest, tastiest food I've had in San Francisco to date. Had a chicken taco with guacamole and sour cream, utterly delishious.....and the watermelon drink was lovely. Highly recommended.

excerpts: I got the chicken burrito with an add of sour cream and chips that I used to test out the homemade salsas (the two hot sauces are HOT).
The salsa verde was excellent and I added some of the chopped onions to it to make it a little chunkier and more scoopable.
Paid approximately $11 for burrito/chips/coke.
Not cheap but good value.
Everything was incredibly fresh (chicked cooked to order) and the pinto beans were out of this world!
I will be coming back here a lot.
sour cream.author: Robbie K.
sour cream.review: Amen. The Marina needs more good, simple Mexican food and this place is #1 in my book now. I love Tacolicious but it is a bit of a scene and this is great if you just want some good food without dealing with a crowd. I got the chicken burrito with an add of sour cream and chips that I used to test out the homemade salsas (the two hot sauces are HOT). The salsa verde was excellent and I added some of the chopped onions to it to make it a little chunkier and more scoopable. Paid approximately $11 for burrito/chips/coke. Not cheap but good value. Everything was incredibly fresh (chicked cooked to order) and the pinto beans were out of this world! I will be coming back here a lot.

excerpts: I had the veggie burrito, it was very good, veggies were nice texture, good bite size chunks.
veggies.author: Adrian M.
veggies.review:
I like that you can pre-order for pickup, and they have it all ready for you. 
I had the veggie burrito, it was very good, veggies were nice texture, good bite size chunks. 
Salsa was not very spicy, but I like a big kick. 

Music they play was super cool, I love it ! Service was nice, I will be back here for sure!

excerpts: I had the vegetarian burrito but the veggies were well-seasoned and was no where near bland, which can sometimes be the case with vegetarian dishes.
Make sure to grab the sauces to layer on with each bite, they add a nice flavor kick to each bite.
The guacamole is absolutely delicious here.
There isn't much seating
veggies.author: Michelle W.
veggies.review:
If you want a damn good breakfast burrito, you will find it at this place. 

Huge breakfast burritos that will leave you full until dinner time. You can substitute potatoes for rice in the breakfast burrito. I had the vegetarian burrito but the veggies were well-seasoned and was no where near bland, which can sometimes be the case with vegetarian dishes. Make sure to grab the sauces to layer on with each bite, they add a nice flavor kick to each bite. The guacamole is absolutely delicious here. There isn't much seating so it's best to order takeout and take your meal to the Marina Green or back home. 

Also, ToMa is an inexpensive breakfast option for the city!

excerpts: I had the pork chile verde with fajita veggies.
The nice gentleman behind the counter gave me a sample
and I was hooked.
veggies.author: Brian C.
veggies.review:
TOMA is really just a taco/burrito takeout joint, but boy what a joint it is. Simply amazing burritos made however you like. Fajita style, chile verde, you name it. I had the pork chile verde with fajita veggies. The nice gentleman behind the counter gave me a sample and I was hooked. Said it was slow cooked for many hours. 

Indeed, it was mouth watering. We then chatted for a while. I asked him about the salsas. He pointed to one in the back and said it was his favorite because it was his grandmother's recipe and he grew up with it. Gotta appreciate that. Be warned, the burrito will cost you $10. But it will fill you for the entire day, and will be one of the best burritos you've ever had in your life.

excerpts: But for veggies only?
veggies.author: Jason B.
veggies.review:
Too much.

Wish I was referring to the food. Calabacitas burrito with grilled squash, zucchini, tomatoes and onion was great. Extra black beans. Lettuce instead of cheese.

Flour tortillas are your only option.

Great indeed. But $7.50 great? Not so much.

Other options might be better. All meat comes from Golden Gate Meat Company which certainly justifies a higher price. But for veggies only?

Way too much.

excerpts:
-I asked for no rice and extra lettuce and veggies- clearly no extra veggies, and there was no lettuce whatsoever. 
-I asked for spicy salsas and cilantro, and received none
-Due to minimum order for delivery, I added 4 servings of vegetables, this arrived as about 1 cup of vegetables in a small plastic container
veggies.author: J B.
veggies.review:
I had 2 experiences with Toma, and they were very different. In a neighborhood like the marina, it's nice to have some better mexican options that aren't several times the cost of other neighborhoods in the city. Casual, and more authentic place, more like the mexican you might get in the Mission. 

The first time I walked in and walked out with a stellar, loaded order of nachos with lots of carne asada, great toppings, salsas, etc, etc. Perfecto!

The second time I ordered on the internet for delivery and it was not so great:
-The food arrived cold, and about 30 minutes later than specified.
-The portion was about half of what I had received previously!
-I paid extra for roasted vegetables and got 1-2 mushrooms in one and a piece of squash in the other- seriously guys?
-I asked for no rice and extra lettuce and veggies- clearly no extra veggies, and there was no lettuce whatsoever. 
-I asked for spicy salsas and cilantro, and received none
-Due to minimum order for delivery, I added 4 servings of vegetables, this arrived as about 1 cup of vegetables in a small plastic container
-The delivery fee was extra

Needless to say, I will order in person and never do delivery from here again. The food is good but wow, this online ordering service was a big mistake. C'mon guys, really?

excerpts: The carne asada is as good as everyone praises it to be, and I almost want to do just a carne asada without the veggies next time just because I want more steak!
You can definitely taste the freshness here!
Best part is, 10 bucks can get you a hefty lunch and some change for your meter.
veggies.author: annie w.
veggies.review: I'm going to jump on the wagon and praise TOMA for finally bringing downright delish Mexican food into the Marina. I had the veggie burrito with added carne asada because I can't go on without meat so I was glad to hit all the food groups with my burrito. The carne asada is as good as everyone praises it to be, and I almost want to do just a carne asada without the veggies next time just because I want more steak! You can definitely taste the freshness here! Best part is, 10 bucks can get you a hefty lunch and some change for your meter.

excerpts: It ended up being $50 for a burrito, quesadilla, chips and guac and three beers.
chips.author: Nima A.
chips.review:
I came here in search of a calm and affordable place to grub in the Marina during the Fleet Week Air Show. The food was excellent -- I ordered a wet chicken burrito and it was MONSTROUS.

My partner ordered a chicken quesadilla and it was definitely decent.

The burrito could easily feed two people with leftovers. The quesadilla might leave you scrummaging through the chip bag afterwards. Between the two, you can easily feed three hungry guys with leftovers.

I was a little floored by the bill. It ended up being $50 for a burrito, quesadilla, chips and guac and three beers.

The guac was really good and a healthy portion as well. I still debate as to whether I would order it again if I were to return.

The beers were out of a bottle --standard fare.

I will say, customer service was excellent, especially for a quick-service grab-n'-go-type restaurant that this is. The gentleman who rang us up checked on us a few times and made sure we had utensils and everything we needed.

All in all, I would come back, though I'd probably ditch the beers and guac because they dirtied the bill and didn't add enough to the experience to justify.

excerpts: The chips salsa/guacamole was also really good as well.
They have multiple salsas you can get, as well as other little toppings to add to your dish.
Employees were friendly and service was fast!
chips.author: Bethany M.
chips.review:
If you like fresh, good Mexican food for a great price then you need to check this place out. We were walking back home after an afternoon stroll today and we came upon this place (found on yelp) and I'm so glad we did. 

We were craving Mexican earlier today & this spot definitely footed the bill. It's kind of like a better version of chipotle. They have bowls, burritos, tacos etc... and you can make it fajita style (+$1.25) in which we did and it was delicious. 

The chips salsa/guacamole was also really good as well. They have multiple salsas you can get, as well as other little toppings to add to your dish. Employees were friendly and service was fast!

excerpts: We enjoyed sitting outside and splitting a burrito bowl and guacamole and chips.
If you check in with Yelp, you get a free bag of chips too!
chips.author: Matt M.
chips.review:
My wife and I were talking earlier today how we needed to find a good, cheap Mexican restaurant in our neighborhood. We found it here. Not a ton of options but good flavor and very reasonably priced. 

There are only about 2 seats inside and a few tables outside but it wasn't that busy. Seems like a lot of folks come in and get the food to go. We enjoyed sitting outside and splitting a burrito bowl and guacamole and chips. 

This will be our go to spot for some cheap (but tasty) Mexican food! 

If you check in with Yelp, you get a free bag of chips too!

excerpts: If you check in on Yelp, you get a free bag of chips but you can tell that the chips are not made in store and probably from a bag.
chips.author: Cecille W.
chips.review:
As always, I was lured in by the promise of a freshly-made corn tortilla. But after I got my tacos I realized there is a difference between a freshly made corn tortilla and a HAND-made tortilla. Anyhow, the tortilla itself was thick and too soft - to the point where I could not taste it and it kind of dissolved a bit from the liquid coming from the meat. They have special meats of the day and on Wednesdays it's carnitas. I also got a carne asada and camarones (shrimp) taco. ($3.25 each) The meat quality was great, the carne asada had large chunks of steak that was still a little rare, which I liked a lot. Shrimp and carnitas were made perfectly and well seasoned. 

My boyfriend ordered a carne asada quesadilla, a horchata, and a side of guacamole. He too, said the carne asada was really good. The salsa bar is limited and none of the salsas really stood out to me, they were pretty bland. The guac costs an extra dollar-something and they give it to you in a small container the same size as you would get from the salsa bar. I was disappointed to find that the guacamole was even more bland and very lacking in seasoning compared to other Mexican places I've been to. If you check in on Yelp, you get a free bag of chips but you can tell that the chips are not made in store and probably from a bag. *sigh* 

There is a sign that says there is a secret menu if you go on their website, but we went on the website only to find that neither the items on the menu nor the prices match up (it's now more expensive). I think Toma is an okay place to get Mexican food but like another Yelper said, it's not mind-blowing. It's also very small inside with only one table and a few bar style seats against the wall.

excerpts: Took off one star because the chips are really lacking (see Tacko or Tacolicious).
chips.author: Mike P.
chips.review:
Easily the best burrito north of Noe Valley. Toma's menu has plenty of options. Took off one star because the chips are really lacking (see Tacko or Tacolicious). 

I will continue to order from Toma.

excerpts: Pro-tip: Check into Yelp for a free bag of chips!
chips.author: Carol L.
chips.review:
I'm a little surprised by how well rated this place is. Firstly, Toma is such a tiny store. There is honestly only enough room inside for 6 - 8 people to stand/sit around. They do have a couple small spots outside to sit at. 

Our food came out pretty slowly and not in any type of order. People who ordered before me got their food way after I did. They also don't fill the cups all the way in their drinks which is kinda disappointing considering that it's not cheap.

I got the carne asada bowl, which while good was kind of small if you don't pay to get extra toppings. My friends enjoyed their tortas, quesadillas, and nachos, but it wasn't mind blowing and this is somewhere we wouldn't go out of our way to get or eat at if we were in the area.

Pro-tip: Check into Yelp for a free bag of chips!

excerpts: PRO TIP: don't get any of the sides on "the side" they cost extra and if you check in at the place you get FREE CHIPS!
chips.author: Miguel E.
chips.review:
Food is great here and reasonable price for being in the Marina. They fry their burritos and add sweet peppers and onions by default so you might wanna tell them before hand. Sour cream, gauc, cheese is all extra which I thought was crazy! But the servings are good and there's free salsa! 
PRO TIP: don't get any of the sides on "the side" they cost extra and if you check in at the place you get FREE CHIPS!

excerpts: Chips are not good.
Limes are cut to small.
chips.author: Kelly A.
chips.review: It's an upscale hole in the wall taco joint . Service is slow because they make stuff fresh . Chips are not good. Limes are cut to small.

excerpts: I wound up ordering a pork quesadilla and half-chicken, half-beef bowl, with free bag of chips and salsa for checking in on Yelp!
chips.author: Sheila D.
chips.review:
I got takeout TOMA as a pick-me-up for a friend who was having a bad day. I wound up ordering a pork quesadilla and half-chicken, half-beef bowl, with free bag of chips and salsa for checking in on Yelp!

I love TOMA because 1) it's close to my home since I live in the Marina, and 2) it's really reasonably priced Mexican food that isn't Chipotle. Everything on the menu is less than $10 and is made to order, so it's super fresh and steaming hot when you get your food. 

The meat here is really delicious. I think that's why I enjoyed the food so much since the pork, beef, and chicken was so, so tasty. The protein MADE the dish. My quesadilla was super flavorful, though I did expect a larger portion size for the price that I paid. The bowls are a similar price and came with much more stuff.

Honestly, nothing really horrible to say about TOMA other than the fact that I didn't get the nicest vibe from the worker there. He was kind of blunt and slightly rude. It also kind of has a hole-in-the-wall feel to the place, which makes me automatically associate dirtiness with it, regardless of how clean the place actually is. Maybe they could amp up the decor a little bit more to make it seem more clean and welcoming. Also thought that there was a little too much grease in my food... to the point that my quesadilla got my hands dripping in oil after I finished it.

If your'e looking for an affordable meal with Mexican food, TOMA is your place! Highly recommend if you're looking to dine on a budget!

excerpts: I think my favorite part was the squash and tomatoes, and the salsa and chips.
His quesadilla was much better.
Don't forget to check in on Yelp for a free bag of chips!
It's a LOT of chips, and the salsa bar is awesome.
I liked the mango salsa as well as the salsa verde.
chips.author: Steph V.
chips.review:
My boyfriend and I found ourselves in Cow Hollow looking for casual food in a pretty fancy area. Toma was exactly the price point we were going for. 

I ordered a vegetable bowl with squash, tomatoes, and onions, and he got a chicken quesadilla. I thought the bowl was just average - I think my favorite part was the squash and tomatoes, and the salsa and chips. His quesadilla was much better. I would get that next time if I am in the area. 

We don't spend that much time here, but it would be a good place to come back to if looking for cheaper options. It's a pretty small place, so I guess more of a to-go place instead of sit down. Don't forget to check in on Yelp for a free bag of chips! It's a LOT of chips, and the salsa bar is awesome. I liked the mango salsa as well as the salsa verde.

excerpts: you go for free chips!
chips.author: Neil P.
chips.review:
I love the salsa bar.

The championes, or mushroom one is the best option. Their quesadillas are alright, but their burrritos are very good.

Make sure to check in everytime you go for free chips!

excerpts: Check in for free chips!
Go!
chips.author: Carena N.
chips.review:
I think I just about fell in love with their shrimp tacos and their carne asada rojas burrito...

Shrimp tacos were just about perrrfect.  Shrimp was super moist and cooked just right.  Everything about this taco was juicy AF.  Tortilla was freshly made!  It was thicker than what I'm usually used to, but still very good!

Carne asada roja burrito was mouth-watering.  So much juicy meat and the extra peppers were delicious.  Not spicy at all, but that can be fixed with some Tapatio or spicy salsa.

Only thing that I didn't like so much was the Pork Sopas.  Meat was a bit dry, and too much sopa.  Too much, too thick.  @_@ Two sopas in each order was already way too much for one sitting.  Also, too much beans which really overpowered the entire thing.  The beef sauce that came with this was delicious though!

Go for the shrimp tacos if anything!!! Burrito to follow.  Skip out on the sopas.  Check in for free chips! Go! *___*

excerpts: We also had their guacamole, pico and chips.
Flavor was on point, and the guy working the counter was really attentive and friendly.
Definitely support these guys!
chips.author: Kristopher S.
chips.review: Visited Toma tonight and enjoyed a burrito and my lady enjoyed their sopes. Everything was really tasty! We also had their guacamole, pico and chips. Flavor was on point, and the guy working the counter was really attentive and friendly. Definitely support these guys!

excerpts: I had a wet chorizo and egg burrito and the free bag of chips
(YAY!)
from the Yelp thing.
chips.author: Chris S.
chips.review:
What a cool find. Cute and small, but the food is great and the service is stellar. I came in here on a Saturday morning and it was the perfect way to start the day. The service and the atmosphere just really made the place sing. Josh was the server and we immediately connected about shared interest in music; he was super friendly and really gave me a smile to start the day. The outdoor seating and weather was the perfect touch too.

But of course any restaurant must be judged by the quality of the food first and foremost! I had a wet chorizo and egg burrito and the free bag of chips (YAY!) from the Yelp thing. Both of these were made even better by the delicious amazing salsas...packed with flavor. 

This place definitely put a big smile on my face. Note that seating is kind of limited, but you can always take your delicious food to Fort Mason, it's only a couple blocks away.

excerpts: The chips were good.
I threw half the burrito away.
chips.author: Matt M.
chips.review:
The staff was nice.
Meat was salty & had a few fat chunks. 
Wet burrito medium size
The "wet" red sauce too salty. Hot sauce & green sauce wasn't too great it was all over seasoned.
Probably should have gotten the tacos.
The chips were good.
I threw half the burrito away.

excerpts: Way too much lettuce more than chips!
For that price they added mushrooms which made my stomach bloated for 3 days.
The nachos were just thrown in the microwave and the cheese was melted that way.
Totally unprofessional.
I will never go to this place again.
chips.author: Joey G.
chips.review: First off the music was blasting at 11 am. A place this small should not be playing music with trumpets so loud. You would think a soccer game was about to start. The place has no restroom and they told me to go use the restroom at another restaurant which I should have went to in the first place. I order nachos which turned out to be 13.99 and there wasn't even any guacamole in it.Way too much lettuce more than chips! For that price they added mushrooms which made my stomach bloated for 3 days. The nachos were just thrown in the microwave and the cheese was melted that way. Totally unprofessional. I will never go to this place again.

excerpts: The decried beans were dry, the chips were store bought, guacamole was literally just creamed avocado (since when can you call that guac?)
the carne asada meat in my bowl was good but there was so little meat.
chips.author: Angie B.
chips.review: Not good at all. The decried beans were dry, the chips were store bought, guacamole was literally just creamed avocado (since when can you call that guac?) the carne asada meat in my bowl was good but there was so little meat.

excerpts: We also checked  in via Yelp and got free chips.
I usually don't like chips at Mexican restaurants but these chips were hearty and flavorful.
They also have a sauce bar with 3 different sauces and pickled onions, in addition to bottled red and green salsas.
While we were there for 45 minutes, we saw at least ten people either dine in or carry out.
chips.author: Monica J.
chips.review:
WOW! Where has this place been.

You know what I love about small no frills joints, they usually get pt all their effort into their food flavors, and with Toma, it absolutely fits this quality.

My friend and I went here last Friday and ordered two vegetarian fajitas (one with zucchini and squash and the other with mushrooms) - both came wiht onions and green peppers. The flavors were delicious!  We also checked  in via Yelp and got free chips. I usually don't like chips at Mexican restaurants but these chips were hearty and flavorful.  They also have a sauce bar with 3 different sauces and pickled onions, in addition to bottled red and green salsas.  While we were there for 45 minutes, we saw at least ten people either dine in or carry out. Definitely seems like a winning spot.  

Highly recommend;  I know I'll be back ;)

excerpts: We ordered the chicken burrito and some chips (they were free after I checked-in via Yelp).
The portion was quite nice, the meat was well-seasoned, and the salsa we used for our chips was fresh!
chips.author: Paul C.
chips.review:
This puny restaurant has quite a lot to offer than I expected. My girlfriend and I wanted something really simple so we could take it to Marina Green and eat while enjoying the Golden Gate view. We ordered the chicken burrito and some chips (they were free after I checked-in via Yelp). The portion was quite nice, the meat was well-seasoned, and the salsa we used for our chips was fresh! We had a really good meal, and kind of regretted not ordering more!

The only drawback is that the restaurant was very cramped, and it seemed like they didn't wipe the tables as often. I could find stains on their tables, and I was a bit bothered while waiting for our food. But if you want a quick Mexican take-out, then this is a place to go! Also, a big shoutout to one of the guys who tried to impress me with his minimal Korean skills! (I'm Korean, and I speak fluent Korean).

excerpts: The chips were also not very good because it's those type of chips you get at movie theaters for nachos.
blegh.
Service was friendly and outdoor seating was nice.
Not coming back here again though.
chips.author: Jacqui C.
chips.review: Was very disappointed because the tacos were too thick and very soggy. I got the vegetable and chicken tacos. The fillings were very tasty but the thick and mushy corn tortilla was not pleasant to eat. The chips were also not very good because it's those type of chips you get at movie theaters for nachos. blegh. Service was friendly and outdoor seating was nice. Not coming back here again though.

excerpts: Ordered a chicken burrito and chips with guac for delivery today.
The chips and guac are also a really good deal!
Chips are a little salty but they gave you a huge thing of fresh guac for only $4.
Also points for a delivery around 45 minutes, which is hard to come by in the city.
Breakfast burrito will be my next try here!
chips.author: Allison D.
chips.review: Ordered a chicken burrito and chips with guac for delivery today. The burrito came with refried beans, rice, sour cream, guac and chicken. The ingredients were really fresh and tasted similar to a mission-style burrito. The chips and guac are also a really good deal! Chips are a little salty but they gave you a huge thing of fresh guac for only $4. Also points for a delivery around 45 minutes, which is hard to come by in the city. Breakfast burrito will be my next try here!

excerpts: Got chips and guacamole and the salsa!
Great food and a lovely time!
chips.author: Marie-Louise O.
chips.review: Amazing service with the sweetest girl taking our order! Recommended the barabquavo sort of a pulled pork bowl, looks amazing! Tastes better! And then the tacos! Got chips and guacamole and the salsa! Great food and a lovely time!

excerpts:
So if you wanted to add guacamole and/or sour cream to your burrito or taco you would only be able to add one and would not be able to add something like chips. 
In addition, they need to read the tickets on GrubHub orders because half of our order was incorrect. 
Would have been four stars if they had not blown the order so badly.
chips.author: Alex A.
chips.review:
The food was very good.    The execution was sorely lacking. 
Their GrubHub options leave it so that on any dish ordered you may only pick one thing to add to it. So if you wanted to add guacamole and/or sour cream to your burrito or taco you would only be able to add one and would not be able to add something like chips. 
In addition, they need to read the tickets on GrubHub orders because half of our order was incorrect. 
Would have been four stars if they had not blown the order so badly.

excerpts: The chips for my nachos tasted like they were a week old!!
The nachos were completely stale!
I also had a burrito which was fine, nothing to get excited about.
I came back to this place because the first time I thought  everything was good, the service was great-
chips.author: J C.
chips.review: I've been to this place twice. The first time I came, I had a good experience, but was a less than average time.  The chips for my nachos tasted like they were a week old!! The nachos were completely stale! I also had a burrito which was fine, nothing to get excited about. I came back to this place because the first time I thought  everything was good, the service was great- the guy even gave my girlfriend and I free tacos and drinks! Today was a totally different story- probably won't return in the future.

excerpts: Whether it is guac and sour cream in our burrito bowls or forgetting to add salsa with the chips ( and really salsa in general.
When you order mexican you expect salsa.
Should be a given.)
I also don't get how they make their own tortillas but have store bought chips?
I keep going back because the meat and homemade tortillas.
And would love to give this place 5 stars if they picked their delivery game up.
chips.author: Mark M.
chips.review:
This place is great. We order from here about once a month for delivery. We have tried all the Mexican places in the area and TOMA serves the best meat. Their chicken and steak are what should get this place 5 stars...but... 

Where they can pick it up a bit is on their delivery. Every time, at least one item is always missing. Whether it is guac and sour cream in our burrito bowls or forgetting to add salsa with the chips ( and really salsa in general. When you order mexican you expect salsa. Should be a given.) I also don't get how they make their own tortillas but have store bought chips? I keep going back because the meat and homemade tortillas. And would love to give this place 5 stars if they picked their delivery game up.

excerpts: After witnessing this I went to the register to change my order to a quesadilla and side of chips and salsa.
You can tell a lot about a Mexican place by their salsa bar.
TOMA's salsas were literally the most watered down and flavorless I've had in my life.
chips.author: Dan G.
chips.review:
I'm shocked by the 4 1/2 star review of this place, given my experience.  I was hoping this would finally be the legit, go-to Mexican spot near Chestnut, but nope, it isn't.  I'm just glad I didn't get sick based on what I saw inside this place!

I ordered a carne asada burrito to go. After ordering, I sat and watched the cooks in the back.  The guy manning the grill proceeded to pull raw chicken out of the marinade bucket and put it on the grill, then use the same tongs to flip and remove the carne asada that was on the other side of the grill. He did this numerous times, potentially cross contaminating the meat that was being pulled off the grill. Dude, that's like cooking 101.  

After witnessing this I went to the register to change my order to a quesadilla and side of chips and salsa. You can tell a lot about a Mexican place by their salsa bar.
