TOMA's salsas were literally the most watered down and flavorless I've had in my life. Whether they're watered down to save money or because the cooks don't know what they're doing, it doesn't really matter, either way this is a sure sign of a subpar Mexican joint.  

The quesadilla was nothing to write home about. 

I also asked for a side of enchilada sauce which they forgot to put in the bag. 

I can't think of a single reason to return to this place.

excerpts: I ordered a chicken burrito and chips and guacamole for delivery.
The burrito's here are standard.
It includes a flour tortilla, your choice of meat/vegetables, your choice of refried or black beans, cheese, and pico de gallo.
I added guacamole to my chicken burrito for a $1 so it ended up being $8.25.
The burrito was delicious and it was decently sized.
It took me two sittings to eat it
The chips and guacamole were a great deal for $4.
It came with a lot of guacamole and although the chips were a little salty, it was still good.
The delivery was around 45 minutes but our food came fresh and warm.
Will definitely order from here again!
chips.author: Hana K.
chips.review: Definitely one of the best burritos I've had in the Marina area. I ordered a chicken burrito and chips and guacamole for delivery. The burrito's here are standard. It includes a flour tortilla, your choice of meat/vegetables, your choice of refried or black beans, cheese, and pico de gallo. I added guacamole to my chicken burrito for a $1 so it ended up being $8.25. The burrito was delicious and it was decently sized. It took me two sittings to eat it and although I was full, I didn't feel sluggish, which is usually my problem with burritos. The chips and guacamole were a great deal for $4. It came with a lot of guacamole and although the chips were a little salty, it was still good. The delivery was around 45 minutes but our food came fresh and warm. Will definitely order from here again!

excerpts: I ordered the carne asada burrito with guacamole for $9 (with no free chips) , and after eagerly biting it I was wondering why it was all mush with not much substance.
chips.author: Lars B.
chips.review:
Very underwhelming burrito that tries to attract its clientele via a nice front and the temptation of quality meat. However, for the price, the amount of food you get and the utter lack of any flavor, I warn people not to come here. Initially, I was brought to this restaurant via yelp, and therefore I want to review on yelp to say that the 4 star reviews are deceiving. I ordered the carne asada burrito with guacamole for $9 (with no free chips) , and after eagerly biting it I was wondering why it was all mush with not much substance. 

The rice, beans, guacamole, meat just all was one being flavorless mush. Thankfully I had a little tapatio from the restaurant, but soon I ran out, and then I was scampering around the house for some ability to give this mush some flavor!!! I only had some sriracha and man that wasn't too satisfying.

No good.

excerpts:
No free chips bums me out
No whole heat tortilla option.
No shredded chicken option.
chips.author: Captain B.
chips.review:
Pros:
Had a burrito, which was great.
Friendly

Cons:
No free chips bums me out
No whole heat tortilla option.
No shredded chicken option.

excerpts: I have had burritos and chips and guacamole on my lunch breaks but my newest favorite is the bowl featured below with black beans, Guac, and the calabacitas veggie option (both are great by the way), and topped with fresh limes and hot sauce complimentary for customers to grab.
If you feel like a big spender, try the Horchata, it's the perfect amount of sweet.
chips.author: Jasmine W.
chips.review: Always a good meal here, and love sitting and talking to whoever is working the register and cooking my food! I'm a vegetarian and I switch it up and my boyfriend swears my there carne asada! It is a small place so very easy to miss off of Steiner, in between a parking garage and Barney's, but trust you do not want to miss it. I have had burritos and chips and guacamole on my lunch breaks but my newest favorite is the bowl featured below with black beans, Guac, and the calabacitas veggie option (both are great by the way), and topped with fresh limes and hot sauce complimentary for customers to grab. If you feel like a big spender, try the Horchata, it's the perfect amount of sweet.

excerpts: I got the chicken burrito with an add of sour cream and chips that I used to test out the homemade salsas (the two hot sauces are HOT).
The salsa verde was excellent and I added some of the chopped onions to it to make it a little chunkier and more scoopable.
Paid approximately $11 for burrito/chips/coke.
Not cheap but good value.
Everything was incredibly fresh (chicked cooked to order) and the pinto beans were out of this world!
I will be coming back here a lot.
chips.author: Robbie K.
chips.review: Amen. The Marina needs more good, simple Mexican food and this place is #1 in my book now. I love Tacolicious but it is a bit of a scene and this is great if you just want some good food without dealing with a crowd. I got the chicken burrito with an add of sour cream and chips that I used to test out the homemade salsas (the two hot sauces are HOT). The salsa verde was excellent and I added some of the chopped onions to it to make it a little chunkier and more scoopable. Paid approximately $11 for burrito/chips/coke. Not cheap but good value. Everything was incredibly fresh (chicked cooked to order) and the pinto beans were out of this world! I will be coming back here a lot.

excerpts: They could upgrade their chips
you'll forget all about the shitty chips.
Good salsa as well and finally a take out mexi food place in the marina!
chips.author: Scott C.
chips.review: Get the sopes!!!  Best thing I've ever eaten!  Or get anything else it's all equally as good!  They could upgrade their chips but once you try the home made sopes or tortillas you'll forget all about the shitty chips.  Good salsa as well and finally a take out mexi food place in the marina!

excerpts: We enjoyed sitting outside and splitting a burrito bowl and guacamole and chips.
If you check in with Yelp, you get a free bag of chips too!
guacamole and chips.author: Matt M.
guacamole and chips.review:
My wife and I were talking earlier today how we needed to find a good, cheap Mexican restaurant in our neighborhood. We found it here. Not a ton of options but good flavor and very reasonably priced. 

There are only about 2 seats inside and a few tables outside but it wasn't that busy. Seems like a lot of folks come in and get the food to go. We enjoyed sitting outside and splitting a burrito bowl and guacamole and chips. 

This will be our go to spot for some cheap (but tasty) Mexican food! 

If you check in with Yelp, you get a free bag of chips too!
